Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very loud”
Reviews.Author: CJtravelerDenver
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a good location near the convention center. However, it is very large, filled with conference-goers, and very loud! Many of the rooms open into a hallway that is a balcony which overlooks the fountain and atrium on the second level. (The fountain is there to drown out the noise, but you can still hear it.) It looks beautiful, but at night, it gets even louder with partiers at the bar. (For us, on a Thursday night, they partied until 2:30 in the morning!) If you prefer less noise, I'd request a room down a hallway that doesn't overlook the atrium. If you are not in your room, but in the main area of the hotel, it is almost impossible to have a conversation with anyone on a cell phone because of the general noise.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Lacking in Service”
Reviews.Author: DC-Logan
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since our stay there this past fall but I can still remember how average this stay was in Dallas. We were there for a very large conference and overall they seemed unprepared and were not staffed appropriately. I'm a Hyatt member with a profile and always request high floor and quiet which usually means away from the elevator. First room was next to the elevator lobby and had not been cleaned; I called down and they moved me to a room on a lower floor but further from the elevator. Rooms are large but very dark and dated and if you are on a low floor be prepared for highway noise on one side of the hotel and train whistles through the night on the other side of the hotel. Luckily, I got the highway side; which seemed quieter according to my colleagues. Dining is limited and there is really nothing close by within walking distance. The only good meal we had was at Five-Sixty by Wolfgang Puck. After several nights of "we're booked" we finally got a decent table by the window and enjoyed an excellent meal; despite the misplaced attitude of the hostess. Otherwise there is a terrible Tex-Mex and Italian place downstairs. One person in our party simply could not eat his meal it was so bad. Like I said, we were there for a conference and as you may imagine the hotel was fairly full with the bar area packed each evening. They were clearly understaffed and at times the manager had to clear the empties from our table. Overall, the only reason we were here was due to a negotiated discount conference rate. I would never stay here on my on dime. Wish we could have stayed at the new Omni but it had not opened yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Very Good Bar and Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Jeannemacl
Reviews.Content: We knew this Hyatt had 1100 rooms and we knew it was a convention hotel; what we did not know was that the convention checking-in at the same time we were was the North Texas Leadership Training for Christ with almost 6,000 children between the ages of 8 and 16, plus their parents, grand-parents, siblings, etc. There was a lot of noise and general pandemonium and no available bell persons. The front desk person apologized that we were not informed and gave us a $20 coupon for drinks at the bar! My first impression was that would not be near enough. We then worried about getting an elevator to the 21st floor and were delighted to find that the conference sponsors had volunteers at the elevator stops regulating the flow and making sure the young people were not monopolizing the elevators. The room was lovely â€“ the view magnificent. Charlie, the bartender made a mean-drink and entertained us with stories of bartending in Texas. The breakfast at the Centenial restaurant was one of the best we have ever had in a hotel. The food was fresh, displayed beautifully, and delicious. The staff was attentive and made our Easter brunch memorable. The hotel is getting a multi-million dollar face-lift this Spring which will update the facility, but they could not improve on the view from the 21st floor or the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRVFAN4EVR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight for a second time in less than a year. First let me say the hotel is huge & beautiful, inside & out. The location is great as it is at the edge of downtown Dallas. We always get a government rate, which makes this a super deal in my opinion. In my online reservation, I asked for a high floor & NOT facing east, as we were gonna be out late & wanted to sleep in the next morning. Our room was on the 9th floor (963), facing east. :-( We checked in late & didn't want to bother with changing rooms, so we didn't say anything. We opened the curtain & saw a beautiful night view downtown Dallas & ......the train station below. I thought, this is gonna be a noisy night. But it wasn't. We only heard a train blow it's horn once. The room was large & beautiful. The bathroom was clean, spacious & very nice. The bed was really comfy (only complaint is wish they would tuck in the bottom sheet, as it got all bunched up during the night). The room was clean. The door to our room opened into the atrium & it was not too far from the elevators (6 of them). You could hear the water features from the 1st & 2nd floors while in our bathroom, but not in the sleeping area of our room. Also, you could hear the roar of the elevators going up & down pretty much constantly. Once in a while, you could hear the "ding" of them arriving on our floor. You could also hear people talking in the room next to us & outside in our hallway. Again all of this was heard while in the bathroom & not in the sleeping area. We ate at Centinnial Cafe on the property for dinner & it was good. Expensive, but good. We ate (again) later that night when we returned from our outing in the bar, having drinks, chips & queso. Again, quite good. The ambiance in the second floor atrium is really nice. Very relaxing with comfy sofas & chairs all around. The next morning, we got our starbucks coffee in the Coffee bar before heading out. The valet is a bit crazy here..... lots of people coming and going, lots of cabs, but it all went smoothly. You can use the valet service overnight for $22.00 plus tax & tip or self park down the street for $10.00 for every time you come & go. Check-in went smooth & checkout the same. Absolutely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - another US large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Per_FNorway
Reviews.Content: I stayed for some nights at the Hyatt, i have been there before I think, many years ago. It was ok, and probably deserves the very good characteristic, even if my room was at the far end of a looong corridor. It is not a cozy hotel, though, very businesslike, and the food was very so-so. All in all, I was there because it was chosen for me, probably would have chosen soewhere else if I was on my own

Reviews.Title: “Great service, average at best”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: This is a very mediocre hotel. I had a convention rate of $139. This hotel would be a great disappointment at a higher price point. Do not come here for the pool! Service was very good with the exception of the chaos at valet and the long wait for a bellman. Room service personnel were charming. The food was very good. The bed was comfortable, but poorly made. The double sheeting should prevent you from contacting the duvet. Sorely lacking in outlets. Bath products have an unappealing odor. Towels are very thin and just awful. Volleyball teams were poorly behaved and the hotel seemed not to care that the young girls were running amuck. I would not return to this hotel. I would choose a HI express or Hampton before this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All good - until leaving!”
Reviews.Author: funlonghorn
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, very large (~1300 rooms) convention hotel. The public spaces are cavernous, and my only negative would be some of the furniture in the reception area looks a little tired. The bar on the second floor atrium has good food and service. All the staff in the hotel are friendly and courteous. The room was large and spacious, and had the usual amenities. The rotating Tower Lounge, 570+ feet up, offers good (but expensive! $16 for a martini, etc.) drinks and features a Wolfgang Puck restaurant as well as sushi. Very nice and worthy of going to as the views are quite spectacular. The only reason I didn't give them 5 star was due to the getting out of there procedure. First of all, they did not honor my tax exempt certificate, so the final bill had to be redone, and instead of them doing it and redeliver, it required going downstairs and having it done at reception. Then, despite one verbal request of the bell staff and two phone calls, they never came to the room to help with luggage (and we had a lot). The valet staff was overwhelmed, and there was a major traffic of people and cars in the front of the hotel. So, it was a scramble and required three trips to get all of the luggage out of the room. Overall, I would definitely stay there again, but just aware when they are packed (and they were), it can be chaotic on the outbound side!

Reviews.Title: “Typical upscale convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: Came one night for a business meeting and left so can't say much. Room was fairly clean (I had to clean the desk from something sticky), bed comfortable and room was more spacious than most. Staff aimed to please. Food was very good. Rooms could use some updating to furniture (well worn) and definitely more outlets (e.g. Lamps with outlets). Overall good experience but not so great I would go out of my way to return. Tip: don't get a room with a city view - it will be on the side with the train.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: JaeCon
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is nicely located; had a wonderful view of downtown Dallas. The room was very spacious, clean and very comfortable. We slept well on their king size bed with down comforters and pillows. Service staff was accommodating and friendly. Walking distance to DART and close to highway. Wolfgang Puck restaurant Five Sixty is located in this hotel. It is a slow revolving restaurant with a spectacular view of downtown Dallas. The ambiance is contemporary but earthy...worth getting a drink, but can't say the same for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NonaKim
Reviews.Content: While our other hotel choices were sold out, I can't say I was disappointed with this hotel choice. The fitness center was particularly nice - great layout, natural lighting, equipment. The hotel room itself was good - large, terrific view, bed and linens were wonderful (towels too!).....all around good experience. The location isn't the best - don't stay if you want to walk around or you want to be close to amenities, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, better Conference Facility”
Reviews.Author: monmouthprof
Reviews.Content: Recent conference visit to hotel with high school students. Great trip and stay thanks to the Hyatt Regency Dallas. Picture 1,900 middle and high school students running through the hotel in an organized chaos. The hotel even accommodated their prices by giving a 15% discount in the restaurants and shops. Wow!! Large rooms, convenient location to action and rail station, nice service and quality staff. Only after thought was the tiny pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beds, and room: love it!"”
Reviews.Author: StoneAlone
Reviews.Content: The beds and linens are great...slept terrifically! The wake up calls really did happen...the maid service great as was the advice from the concierage. I was there for a HUGE conference and the staff was undaunted by the 1,900 attendees. The location? Only four blocks for Dealy Plaza, a bit further for most dining. CAUTION: the neighborhood goes from good to sketchy to good to great to sketchy. Take a cab to most places.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: InHouseCounsel
Reviews.Content: I just finished 2 nights at the Hyatt Regency in downtown Dallas. It is a large, busy conference hotel. There was a marathon in town the morning I checked in, so the line was huge. I arrived early and decided to see if I could get into a room. I heard one of the staff members say that they had 800 checkouts that morning. I was able to skip the line with platinum Hyatt status, and the folks at the front desk were very efficient and helpful. The room was a typical conference hotel room. The bed was ok, the sheets were clean. The one major negative for the room was that there was only one outlet accessible in the entire room, and one of the two sockets had a lamp plugged in. The other outlets were apparently behind the bedframe and I could not reach them. Hyatt needs to take a lesson from Marriott or Starwood where they put extra outlets at the desk. I ended up charging my phone using the bathroom outlet, though I always worry about water. The positives were helpful staff and a very nice fitness center. The fitness center included several treadmills, ellipticals and bikes, and several weight machines plus free weights. The front desk told me the gym gets too crowded at times, and they are planning to expand it, but I did not experience any issues getting a machine.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Reunion, Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Julie D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Reunion for 3 nights in February on business. The hotel is large, with various conference facilities, and is very conveniently located. My room was perfect â€“ clean, comfortable and quiet. Although I did not use it, there is a nice gym off the lobby. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly and in the lobby there was fresh squeezed lemonade, ice water, fruit baskets and cookies, which I found welcoming. There was a nice bar and several restaurants located on the second floor, and a convenient coffee shop on the main floor. There are shops and restaurants within walking distance. Transportation was never an issue at his hotel, as there were always taxis ready for guests at the front of the hotel, and the train was easily accessible by an underground walkway. As always, Hyatt is always reliable to me as a frequent business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rick-Rozzi
Reviews.Content: Ran the Dallas Rock & Roll Marathon, so we needed a downtown hotel close to the 'race. We were offered a great rate. Runners were allowed to check in early ( for us at 1:00 pm) and then allowed a late check out at 2:00 pm without an additonal charge. We used the Valet Parking, as we needed parking anyway, and this saved us from having to pay for addtional downtown parking ( we could walk were we needed to go). The hotel was busy and parking was hectic as it seemed everyone was arriving or leaving at the same time. But hotel staff were courteous and worked very hard to please us. Rooms were fine, beds comfortable with normal amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the website trick you”
Reviews.Author: Bcn M
Reviews.Content: The website and pictures look fantastic, the outside all shiny glass and impressive, but wait until you enter hotel. It is as if you enter the 70-ties again: brown, green and wood.....and then the smell. Normally hotels smell nice and fresh clean, here it it smells old and if someone has been cooking oily food all day. We arrived with 6 persons and we all heard different stories about the wifi, one had to pay, the other had to join the Hyatt club, the next one got it for free. The rooms are very basic and have not been upstyled for ages. The beds have all loose sheets, so you wake up in a mess. Sometimes directly on the matrass! The duvet is not in a cover, but also between loose sheets, which obviously come off during the night. Very unhygienic!! The lights in the room are very harsh white energy saving bulbs that do to contribute to the atmosphere in the room - which is already basic. And then food - if you want a burger, go for it, the rest I would not recommend. Buffalo wings and quesadillas seem to come from the microwave. The rest of the food seems to have been defrosted. The Italian restaurant tries its best, but misses the point. Steak ok, but risotto sticky and fatty. In the morning there is a great choice to get your own omelette prepared, which is fine. However the smoke and smell from cooking them is flowing into the hotel lobby as there is no air suction system above that stove. Be aware that this happens for at least 4 hours every day. You can smell the oil in your clothes if you sit too close to where they make the omelettes. The rest of the breakfast buffet is ok, just too few fresh fruit and the bread is fabricated and feels old. The food in the coffee shop in the lobby is all fabricated pizzas and sandwiches, coffees and other snacks are fine. The location of the hotel is between a super busy highway which results in a constant humming of cars and on the other side a railroad. When your room is at the side of the railroad and on a lower floor, you hear the trains and the heavy sound of the trains horn/whistle. In general - price vs. quality is nowhere to be seen, you feel cheated. Was there anything good? The 2nd floor bar is ok and bathrooms were fine. I moved to the Hilton hotel and it is a relief to be here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Facilties”
Reviews.Author: cabjohnson
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights here on business. The hotel is large, with various conference facilties. The rooms were nice. The gym was pretty nice as well with a good supply of cardio machines and free use of headphones if you forgot yours. The staff I encountered were all very nice. The parking valet's will hand you free bottles of water if you go out for a walk. The people in the snack shop were very nice also. The hotel has access to the train system which will allow you to travel to various locations. There are shops and restaurants within walking distance (1/4 mile or more) but there is nothing directly adjacent to the property as it is kind of land locked between a Fwy. and the train tracks. The walk is not bad however to get somewhere. You are also maybe 1/4 mile from the site of JFK's assasination.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: yubs3
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel last week for a Spring Break trip with the kids. The hotel staff and JFK package was wonderful. The only opportunity for the hotel are the guest rooms and pool area. We were put in what seemed like the smallest room they had available and it was severely outdated and very dirty . The pool area is also very small and unappealing. We will stay elsewhere if we choose to return to the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: elizabethpg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hyatt Regency for a business trip. When booking with the Hyatt, I've never gone wrong and same applies to this location. Clean rooms, comfortable beds and friendly staff. There was a nice bar on the second floor and a convenient coffee shop on the main floor. There were always taxis ready for guests at the front of the hotel, which was very helpful. The room wasn't the biggest, but unless you have a need for extra room it shouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bentonts
Reviews.Content: Israil was the concierge that saved the day when I left my laptop in the shuttle van! He worked so diligently to recover it that very night and set the bar for an amizing stay. Although the rooms are about avergae, everyone of the staff members treated me and my colleagues better than family. If you have to be in Dallas, the Hyatt Regency Reunion is a great location and a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TeaSip
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice, and both times have been excellent experiences. The staff is top-notch and go out of their way to welcome guests. During both stays, I got food from the bar, which has been very good. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Even though the hotel is quite large and open and next to a train station, I found the rooms to be plenty quiet. I will definitely stay at the Hyatt on my next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Love Rooms - Hyatt Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Ann H
Reviews.Content: March 2012- stayed for 3 days. Great view of Dallas lights from the 22nd floor. The room we stayed in was designed to reduce allergies and included a health air filter as well as all linen designed to reduce allergies. The bed was wonderful and we slept better than we do at home. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovintravelgal
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful and fabulous hotel! It took a while to check-in as there was a large number of us that had arrived at the same time, however that is to be expected in a large hotel such as this. The room was decorated very nicely and had a large desk which I appreciate. When it came time to go to bed I literally SUNK into the mattress! It was heavenly! So incredibly comfortable! All the staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to ensure I had everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but”
Reviews.Author: 94Q45T
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is conveniently located and connected by tunnel to Amtrak and the local rail system. The common areas of the hotel are very nice. I was there with a large conference, which the hotel handled with aplomb. The staff is great. I did not have an opportunity to try the restaurants nor the fitness center. The room was mixed bag. It was clean and the furnishings offered good flexibility with plenty of open plugs and lots of storage space. Unfortunately the bed covers were stained lightly and there were old blood spots both on the top sheet and one of the pillow cases cases. The bottom sheet was flat, not fitted, and it was not large enough to tuck under the mattress. The result was that it shifted freely during the night and pulled the mattress pad with it. The mattress itself was very comfortable, as usual for Hyatts, but sleeping with bunched up sheets and mattress pad is a challenge. In fairness, I'm sure the manager would have fixed the problem immediately, but no one wants to wait for housekeeping at midnight after a hard day. Kudos to Hyatt for putting the toiletries where they belong: shampoos and condition in the tub area, and skin moisturizer and toothpaste by the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Dallas - close to historic district”
Reviews.Author: is0lde
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Dallas so decided to stay in town to explore the older part of Dallas. The Hotel is reasonably well located for this. The facility is huge with its convention center etc. The rooms are average. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would I come back, probably not, as I would like to try maybe the smaller newer hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: texlawdog
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice, paid $80 on priceline. Food was not very good in the restaurant or the bar. Rooms clean and nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Going to need updating soon.”
Reviews.Author: littlejohn
Reviews.Content: Another stay at this nice hotel. You can always expect great service from the staff here and they didn't disappoint this time either. Very courteous as always from the valet to front desk to maids. Only real negative is that the furnishings are starting to show wear. and carpet is worn/dated.

Reviews.Title: “Conference central”
Reviews.Author: MushuAnd
Reviews.Content: If you are here on a conference stay here. If not don't. Its like Grand central station at breakfast morning tea and afternoon tea. Lift congestion is horrendous at break times. One featurec that was good was the computer in the foyer to ptint out boarding oasses - that was nifty and totally set up really well all links worked etc Staff really tried but it was an insane pace of checkin and check outs. Its only 5 minues from JFK museum where he was shot. Down town Dallas was souless and quite empty. Hotel rooms were really old and dated furniture - felt pens used to cover scuff marks and bug gouges out of the furniture. Bathrooms tiles not clean and fresh, Toiletries were small and minimum, no extras. We had a sunset suite first night - not worth it at all - and suite was old scuffed furntire, lamps didn't work. Asked to move rooms because of traffic noise, train noise and then cranes. The pool is the saddest most desperate area. Extremely disappointing. Staff really really tried hard and couldnt fault them.

Reviews.Title: “Bigger is better”
Reviews.Author: j w
Reviews.Content: Great big hotel in the downtown area. Convient to all downtown attractions and museums etc. Restaurants in hotel bar and coffee shop. Very nice but you will pay for the room and every little thing. ie. Internet,tv,bottled water displayed in room 4.50 a bottle and parking. Nothing for free here! $$$$$

Reviews.Title: “The Old Best Inn, on Dallas's Westend”
Reviews.Author: mclarry001
Reviews.Content: Catchy title of my article right. Some may care to say down right prefect after ready this entire review on historic aesthetics of the Hyatt Regency in Dallas, Tx. If I may be perfectly frank, this hotel is very uniquely special to me I was given the opportunity to view the skeletal structure of the each hospitality department from room service, to the small cafe on the second floor, as well as the mediocre bar decor on the second floor, and the outdated ambience of the ballrooms compared to newly renovated hotels on the Westend of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but positive”
Reviews.Author: ConnieRuston717270
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three night and it was fabulous! Every staff member we encountered we're friendly and helpful! We ate at the wolf pack, reservation is needed, centennial cafe and everyone went above and beyond! The room was spacious and extremely clean! The fed ex center is new and very nice. I read some negative reviews of this hotel but I think they are just negative people looking for something to complain about! I book sports teams for a living and this will be my go to hotel for the Dallas area! I know from experience that my teams would be well taken care of, we will be back!! The beds are the best I have ever slept on!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, weird location”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but the location was really odd. It's on the fringe of downtown, but is somewhat cut-off by a ring of roads. Not the best place to stay if you want to explore Downtown Dallas on foot at night.

Reviews.Title: “too many add-on fees”
Reviews.Author: jerseyjazz
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel came as part of an airfare package. I took the "business plan" at an extra $40 a night, which included a full breakfast and in-room wireless Internet access. These items are usually fee-based and would have cost at least $40 alone; the business plan also thows in free US long-distance, a Wall Street Journal or USA Today, a $4.50 bottle of water on your nightstand (with its price sticker prominently marked), and one blouse pressing per day. So the Hyatt gets you either way. Fact is, I can get most of these items free or for a few dollars at almost any chain lodging. Granted, the food at the Hyatt is much better, but.... Physically it's a lovely hotel with wonderful and informative displays on Texas history (ask for the self-guided walking tour brochure at the front desk). The furniture in my room was a little dinged-up, surprising for a luxury hotel of this ilk. The location behind the train station means that (surprise) you'll hear trains. I liked this, but you may not. Temperature controls were good. Walking into town involves climbing a few small hills and passing under a rather unpleasant underpass. I would not have done it after dark. Watch the drivers in Dallas--they are cowboys (haha), and I say that as a bona fide NY jaywalker. I planned to have dinner at the hotel's Italian bistro, but it was closed the nights I was there--"low occupancy" was the reason. The adjacent Centennial Cafe was open. Pricey but good. Service is excellent. Waitstaff and housekeeping staff members are obviously well-trained. Somehow they make their eye contact and smiles seem genuine. One front-desk person was a bit ditzy, but the waiters made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: Nashvillecat
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by my company for a large conference held at the convention center. Location was a big issue for me. Overall, my stay at this hotel was excellent, but the location caused the rating to go down. The hotel is stylish, clean, and comfortable. I had an updated room with a good view of downtown (14th floor), with excellent amenities and a wonderfully comfortable bed. I do not like the fact that there are no fitted sheets, but I find that in many hotels, and can only assume it is easier and cheaper to maintain. My room overlooked the train track, and the noise was surprisingly high at times. If you are a light sleeper and go to bed early, then you should get a room that does not overlook the train track. I did not eat at the Wolfgang Puck tower restaurant, but I did have breakfast and dinner at the hotel restaurants. Both experiences were excellent. The dinner was an elegant pizza, recommended by my waiter. The breakfast was good, as well. If you are interested in sightseeing in Dallas or attending events at the convention center, I would not choose this hotel unless you have a car. Yes, it is rather close to the train station, which could be a plus if you are using it. Otherwise, it is a long distance to walk to restaurants and the convention center. Perfectly possible to walk it, but not a scenic nor a particularly safe walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Catering Staff, Mediocre Hotel Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: mstrieu
Reviews.Content: My company hosted a reception for our clients, roughly 100, at the Hyatt late January. I cannot say enough wodnerful things about the catering staff! They were attentive, friendly, and kept us informed with the levels of food we had left the entire duration of our 2-hour event. Victor, Jesus, and their staff were amazing! With that being said, I did have some other not so stellar experiences in my 15-hour stay. It started with Valet. Due to the size of the Association of Water Board Directors conference (which was held at the Hyatt in 2008, 2010, and 2012), one would think the hotel would be better prepared for the amount of people. It took me 30 minutes from the time I got to the hotel to hand my car to the valet. There didn't seem to be any order with when cars were taken care of. I had 2 bags, a garment bag, 2 posters, and 2 easels, and was not asked if I needed any assistance. Once I made it to my hotel room, unpack all of my bags, and started getting ready for my event at 7pm, I noticed three things "wrong" with the bathroom: the tub did not drain properly, the toilet did not flush properly, and the tub floor was dirty/old with rust. A few other things "wrong" with the room included: the wrong time on the clock (not a big deal), splintered footboard, the dresser being pulled further out than normal because I'm assuming a previous guest was looking for a plug (which I managed to only find in the bathroom), a crack lamp shade, and chipped armrests on the chairs. I was actually very surprised by the noise level. I was able to clearly hear voices outside of my door, and noise from the lobby (7 floors down) well past midnight! I checked out at 7am, and although I was greeted, she did not inquire about my stay. When I told her of some of my issues, as I believed the hotel should be aware of these items, she offered me a free coffee for my trouble, which I did not take her up on. I went to the valet cashier to pick up my car, and no one was available. Someone from guest services managed to track someone down to get my car for me. I guess in short, it can be summarized by these two sentences. The Catering staff was fantastic. The rest of the hotel was lacking. I found it quite disappointing for a Hyatt. I did write the Hyatt of my experience. Still no word a week later. Perhaps this is a reason, the conference will be at another hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just say no!”
Reviews.Author: dfbrewer04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt in January, while attending a conference, and it was a madhouse. The taxi driver let us out in the street because we couldn't make it up to the proper drop-off. Apparently, people leaving the hotel by vehicle had no patience because I was very close to getting run over and my suitcase was spared by only a few inches!!! Took forever to get checked in and when I finally got up to my room, my keys didn't work, so I had to fight the elevators back down, get new keys, then wait in a line for an elevator back up to my room. The room was nice enough. I think there were several conferences going on at the same time. People in the bar area were shouting cheers and the noise reached my room on the 17th floor. Some friends were unable to get waited on in the bar. Overall, not a good experience and I certainly wouldn't stay here again if it's my decision. I only had to stay in January because it was arranged by my firm!

Reviews.Title: “Forget this one and go to the Omni”
Reviews.Author: LakeTappsLady
Reviews.Content: I am at a convention and staying at the Hyatt. Pryor to the event, I stayed one night at the Omni which is a 3 month old hotel with a fantastic steakhouse (Bob's). It was exquisite in everyway. I have always thought of the Hyatt chain as an upscale outfit and expected nothing less than I had experienced the night before. This hotel would remind you of an old Best Western. My room smelled like smoke even though on a non-smoking floor so they sent someone up with a spray bottle. Now it smells like flowery smoke. No real business center, just a desk at a tiny Kinkos office where they charge 40 cents a minute for internet. The hot tub is boarded up with plywood, there is no shopping, no spa and I have woken up to the train going by each day starting at 5pm and it costs more to stay. I say, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MegailnSonja
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my business stay at the Hyatt. The location was great in downtown, and the space was impeccable. It was beautifully decorated, with many different areas to relax or visit in the large lobby. The customer service was 5-star; especially when I was hungry at 2am, and had no car and the room service ended at midnight, and the night Manager found a sandwich and had it brought up to my room. That was going above and beyond and I truly appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “Refit coming”
Reviews.Author: TexPat78
Reviews.Content: Had a sneaky peak at the new rooms on 16 and am looking forward to coming back once the hotel has been refurbed. Loud, brash, over the top. Just like the gorgeous city she looms over, this hotel is a good bargain via Hotwire, though would balk at paying advertised prices. Still charging above and beyond for interwebs, something that one hopes the management will notice as a trend of complaint, even in positive ones like mine. No room service (or bar snacks) post a midnight witching hour, so unless you are craving Chinese delivery make sure to stock up on snacks and munchies for that late night snack. You'd think the management would have sorted this recurrent complaint out as well, but maybe they're making enough from that wifi charge to make up for their losses. But the location, smiling service and just sheer Texan charm makes up for these trivial complaints to ensure conference goer, romantic couple, or family alike all have an enjoyable place to cool their heels. Have no doubt, this grand dame of 1980's kitsch has some life in her yet.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: dlwalt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Dallas Safari Club Convention earlier this month. Bed and bathroom were fine. Had to move furniture to charge electric devices. Most Hyatt's I have stayed in have outlets built into the desks. The hotel can use an upgrade here. Also, please add Comedy Central to your channel line-up Just a little weird looking outside my window and seeing the Grassy Knoll.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Bellboys, Terrible beds, Unresponsive re Suggestions”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer2011
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, five bellboys surrounded us at the trunk. We said we would handle our own bags, thank you. They grabbed 2, I stopped them. They grabbed the 3rd. I told them to stop. I suggested to the hotel security that that was a very bad practice. Our bed had posts lower than the mattress - yes, we bumped our legs into them several times. Ouch. The sheets were not fitted so came loose all the time - very unsanitary. We had to call to get maid service every day. The hotel was very full but....that is no excuse. The other groups held their meetings between the elevators and escalators - high traffic areas - and the hotel did nothing about this. I let the front desk know and she didn't care. As we were leaving, 10 bell boys tried to grab our bags. We told them to not touch a thing. Each in succession asked us if we wanted a taxi. We said no we had a car waiting. Did they have a car waiting for us - and gave them our name. The answer was no. And no, those cars belonged to the hotel. After a half hour, we called the car service. He had been there for 45 minutes in the hotel car line. We spoke to the head guy who had all sorts of excuses. We just barely made our airplane. We called the manager to make suggestions. He heard us, and said he'd call back after he spoke to the people. We're still waiting.....Not holding our breath. The event we attended is using a different hotel next year. Thank goodness.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Ticder
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency in Dallas, the only hotel that had a room left for New Yearâ€™s Eve, we found out why. We drove to the front of the hotel, and valet was right there to greet us despite the overwhelming amount of cars pulling in. The guys were friendly, organized and very competent in getting our bags and ticket for parking in valet. We proceeded inside to check in where we were greeted and welcomed by very friendly staff. We made our way to an extremely long line to check in. They had provided a table of flavored water for the guests checking in, which was a nice touch. Although overwhelmed at the first site of the line, they had 10 staff membersâ€™ checking people in which helped us move quickly through the 25 minute wait at the check in line. Once we received our room key, we walked the long hallway to the two elevators which took us to our â€œwingâ€� of the hotel. Normally two elevators would be sufficient, unless the hotel wasnâ€™t full to capacity of 1500 quests. We walked into a musky, dingy, old hallway to our room. The pictures below show the condition of the room and the disgusting mess that would start our night at the Hyatt. Within 30 minutes of entering our room we had issues with room service, overflowing toilet, lighting issues, plug outlets, and air conditioning smell. Tip; room service does not understand the word â€œcarafeâ€� but understands â€œpitcherâ€� and it only took us 20 minutes on the phone and a lot of frustration to understand this language barrier. After finally ordering a â€œpitcherâ€� of cranberry juice and two glasses, and a bucket of ice; we flushed the toilet and watched as water filled the bathroom floor immediately while one of us tried to turn the water off the other one called for maintenance, which took 45 for them to show up. After using all the towels to clean up the mess, we requested more towels from housekeeping so we could get ready for our New Yearâ€™s Eve plans. This too was a long wait and almost impossible to get. After returning to the hotel later that night we were greeted with the following; no ice at the bar for drinks, no food (bar and restaurant closed at 11 on New Yearâ€™s Eve? smart decision people), one elevator broken, the one elevator that worked was covered in something so sticky my shoes stuck to the floor, food (or blood we couldnâ€™t tell) was smeared on the elevator walls, trash, cups, food lined the hallways. I doubt that this was the Hyattâ€™s first New Yearâ€™s, clearly the management staff was not prepared for the sold out hotel and the cliental that was staying at the run down Hyatt. Maybe they should have the people in charge of valet service run the rest of the hotel. Lesson learned; $200 a night is better spent taking a limo back home than staying at a nasty hotel!

Reviews.Title: “So so!!”
Reviews.Author: pabacat
Reviews.Content: This was the host hotel for a convention I was attending. I felt like the $22 for car valet was outrageous for Dallas. Also, I was ripped off by the car valet attendant. We went out to get a taxi to a downtown restaurant. The attendant said come over here. It was a balck E car. I thought maybe the restaurant provided it. We went maybe 8 blocks. It was $20. When we left the restaurant we got a cab. It was $9.00. I asked the attendant about it, he tried to give me money out of his pocket. I said NO, that I was turning him in. Obviously, he had a little business going with the car driver. The concierge told me that they had been having a problem with that and repaid me my $11.food in the cafe was only "so so" and expensive. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and outstanding views!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust0908
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights in this beautiful hotel to include New Year's eve 2011. Our room was on the 18th floor and we had an incredible view of the Dallas skyline as well as a bird's eye view of the JFK Museum (old Texas Book Depository). The hotel has two restaurants and one lounge. We ate at all three and were not disappointed. Also, if you have the money, the hotel is connected to Reunion Tower in which is located Wolfgang Puck's restaurant Five Sixty. The restaurant rotates and the view is high above Dallas. While we were at the hotel, the Penn State Football team was also there and although the hotel was pretty crowded it did not interfere with any of the normal services. I would definitely choose this hotel on my next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “One Night was Fine”
Reviews.Author: dpbdmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Dec 2012 bought through priceline. Check in very friendly and helpful. Rooms were average -- lumpy beds, clean bathroom and fresh linens, old fixtures in bathroom. BTW - the "city view" room was lovely, but it's also the "train station view" and with trains come noise... very noise with trains throughout the night and into morning... not a pleasant sleep. A quick overnight stay was enough. I'll try something else new time.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay in Texas @ Hyatt Dallas”
Reviews.Author: eks1222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Dallas for the Penn State Bowl game and stayed at the Hyatt Dallas for four days...we loved it! The hotel itself is gorgeous but the Hyatt employees working there are what make it worth staying. Everyone that we encountered the first moment out of the taxi until we departed were helpful, courteous, knew the area of Dallas inside/out and enjoyed their jobs. Even before we arrived for our stay, the concierge helped us make New Year's Eve dining reservations and answered all of our questions. This hotel was taken over by Penn State players, coaches, staff, family and fans so there were a high volume of guests, but the hotel staff never missed a beat. My husband and I dined at the property and the lunch at Centennial Cafe was very good. I also loved the Coffee post so I could get my Gingerbread Lattes from Starbucks each day. If you are looking for a hotel in Dallas close to a lot in the area, staying at the Hyatt is a great choice. You are walking distance to JFK Memorial, 6th Floor Museum, dining options, bars, etc. If you are looking to take a taxi, the fares were great to the West End, Dallas Love Airport and other nearby attractions. We thank the Hyatt for a great stay. We loved our first trip to Texas, we will be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and a Great Room Too!!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaB1
Reviews.Content: I booked the "Awaken package" online which I thought was the best value. It included breakfast and valet parking. The room was very nice for what I paid (we got a king). One thing that I really liked was how the room is situated. The headboard is not facing another guest room rather it is facing the bathroom wall. We were able to hear the people next to us but I suspect that it had more to do with the fact that we had a connecting door than lack of insulation. I have read reviews that stated that they heard noise from the lobby but we heard none. When we needed anything the staff was right there with the answers. The valet was very prompt and the attendants very knowledgeable. The breakfast that was served each morning was wonderful and I would recommend anything that goes with their salsa. Their salsa was some of the best. The servers were on top of things and we were never without coffee or juice. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel for the room but stay here for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: nxf83
Reviews.Content: I had an overall average stay at the Hyatt Regency. The location is only good if you're there for business downtown. Otherwise, it's really hard to find the entrance and not really close to anything. The lobby and common areas are gorgeous and impressive, which is a huge contrast to the rooms. The rooms have more of a bed and breakfast feel to them than that of a big city hotel. By that, I mean they were kind of run down and dated. The bathroom was tiny and more like a bathroom you would expect to find in an apartment. Everything in the room just felt kind of cheap. For example, one morning I was sitting on the (covered) toilet to put on my tennis shoes without waking up my significant other, and the lid caved in. I'm a small person, and the lid was obviously made of really cheap plastic. As others have mentioned, the parking situation is ridiculously expensive and inconvenient for Dallas, but probably fine if you're from another major city. I believe it was $23 per day for valet parking with in and out privileges, and $10 per day for self parking in a non-hotel-affiliated lot across the street without in and out privileges. This is unusual for Dallas, and particularly ridiculous considering that they KNOW nobody staying at the hotel is using public transportation. On the plus side, every employee I encountered was really nice, friendly, and helpful. The gym was small, but had a decent variety of equipment and was really well maintained. It was, however, in an odd corner of the hotel that was really difficult to find, and even more difficult to find my way back to my room from.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place - but needs to do something with the parking/valet”
Reviews.Author: greg_j_shoup
Reviews.Content: It took over a 1/2 hour just to drive up to this hotel. The valet was not working fast enough to keep up with the cars. And don't even think about self-park, you have nowhere to leave your car to check in because the valet is using all those spots too! Other than that - we had a rate deal on the hotel. It served it's purpose, but with all the other events going on, the hallway was a little noisy. I would stay there again if they fixed their parking issues and we had a deal on priceline or hotels.com for under $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Dallas experince”
Reviews.Author: melc12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at this hotel for our first visit to Dallas. This was a huge hotel with several conference rooms and we spent some time wandering the main floor as there was historical information and photographs throughout. The room was clean and comfortable. Valet parking at $22 was pricey and we opted to self park a block away at $10/day but there was no in-and-out privileges. The location of the hotel is a short walk to the west end of downtown close to the Sixth-Floor Museum and Aquarium, however is more isloated compared to other hotels being on the edge of downtown. Fitness facilities were up-to-date and had a nice view. We dined at the Centennial Cafe and went to the bar once. Service was great in both.

Reviews.Title: “Better than last year, excellent food service”
Reviews.Author: tlhjar
Reviews.Content: Returned here this year for a large event. Nice rooms, concierge helpful. Food is excellent, esp. BBQ salmon with blueberry chipotle, pork shoulder sandwich with slaw, collard greens, etc. Good southwestern cuisine. Cons: difficult to walk anyplace due to hills. Outdoor pool only, not open in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average for under $100. Horrible parking!!”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly and helpful front staff. Good downtown location. Nice lobby / fountain with average restaurants. Beds are nice. We have stayed here a few times and each time was $100 or under. So it is priced pretty competitively. Cons: The parking situation is horrible. First the nightly fee is $23 and you have to valet. We stayed for 3 days and our average wait time for our vehicle was 45-1hr in the rain and cold. Doing this with an infant compunded the situation. They even lost our keys one day. Completely disorganized parking system and when the hotel is busy the guest suffers. Make sure you check if there is an event at the hotel. If so, I would recommend not staying for this reason alone. Rooms are showing thier age. The bathroom had mildew on the ceiling and mold around the bath. Pretty unclean for the property type. Doors, walls, carpet and furniture were all pretty beat up. Overall, I like Hyatt and will continue to stay at their properties. However, I will probably not stay at this one due to the parking and that there are better kept properties for the same price in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: johnpg2
Reviews.Content: This was the third time i have stayed at this hotel in the last 15 years,Not much had changed and i was going to the JFK assassinations conferences held here in Dallas over the weekend of the "22nd" November.The hotel is grand as it always is and the staff are wonderful from the bell hops,front desk to bar and resturant,My room 1929 facing the Trinity River and oak cliff was great clean and tidy with a walk in shower and at $68-00 per night was a bargain plus Tax. The only fault i had was the hot tub out of action and the pool not covered at night,The pool was warm even though it was chilly out side and the sub way between the hotel and Union station was closed which was not good for me because of walking with a stick so it was a long walk to Dealey Plaza. This hotel is ideal for visiting the Knoll and the T.B.S.D.and the west End,The dart railway system is close taking you all around the metro area and the service to Fort Worth on the TRE is worth the ride for around $4-00 return,This train is also good for DFW airport. In general still a very good hotel but needs the pool and hot tub up dating now the new Omni is open the Hyatt has a new rival. I had a wonderful stay for my nine nights here at a great rate,I would like to thank every one for making my stay comfortable also the beds were fantastic and i had good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience for a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: ErnieandLoopy
Reviews.Content: We ordered room service and the food was really good. We got the BLTA's and Roasted Chicken Tortilla Soup and were pleasantly surprised. We requested a downtown view, which was given to us free of charge. It was truly a great view. We could see the newly built Omni Hotel light up the night sky from our window. We had a couple of issues with guest services while requesting an additional comforter and shampoo. The air conditioner made weird noises when turning on and off. Other than the one issue, this is a good hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient access to DART Rail”
Reviews.Author: longhorn_mike
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for two nights. Rooms were clean and staff members were knowledgable and friendly. The hotel has convenient access to the DART rail through an underground walkway, making it easy to get around the city without needing a car or taxi. We were fortunate to enjoy a great corporate rate, which was significantly less than the going rate for the weekend of our stay. My one complaint was the valet parking could not handle the capacity of cars during my stay. We were there the weekend of the Texas/Oklahoma football game, so the hotel was extremely crowded, and the valet was actually full when we arrived. Eventually we were able to valet, and when checking out there was a long wait for retrieving the car. Despite this, I would stay here again. Just be sure to allow plenty of time for the valet if staying there when the hotel is busy.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Hyatt?”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideTraveler55
Reviews.Content: Requested a quiet room. I got one right above the railroad. They did accommodate a room change and gave me points for the inconvenience. My new room? Above the freeway! Their location is poor and noisy. Room service is extremely expensive (21% service charge) and had to return the full tray. Their coffee shop claims starbucks coffee, but it's not, it tastes bad. Valet parking is $20 a night and they take forever to bring your car! They have 6 elevators but had 3 stops everytime i took a ride and i was on floor 15. Maybe just 2 or 3 were functioning. Escalators from Lobby to 2nd floor was broken. If you need to connect your laptop, ipad, ipod and smartphone, bring your own extension, there is 1 AC outlet in the room and 2 in the bathroom. I read the hotel GM replies to concerns and i understand his philosophy and it shows on the level of this hotel....too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Exoected a lot more from Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Trippin26
Reviews.Content: I booked a room six weeks in advance for my anniversary. I received an email confirmation the week before my stay, so I assumed everything was good. Upon arrival, I was told that that the hotel was overbooked, and we would be staying in a "parlor/living room." This is a small meeting space connected to a room which has a medium size conference table and a sleeper sofa. This was not at all what I had in mind for my anniversary. The staff was apologetic and comped parking and breakfast, but the romance of the evening was totally lost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service rules!”
Reviews.Author: Nwegener
Reviews.Content: This is a very busy hotel and yet they give the impression that you are the top priority for the time you need assistance. They follow up to see that all is well and you received what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Very average Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: stlanne
Reviews.Content: I was very glad to only be here one night. I recently stayed at the Hyatt in DC and it was light years better. The location is tedious to navigate to if you are unfamiliar. It is 10 min walk to any other restaurant. It was raining so I had room service for lunch. It was bland and not very good. The room was very tied. The furniture was cheap wood and old. The bathroom was cheap and old. My room overlooked the train tracks - was a bit annoying and loud. The ruckus from the drunks in the lobby up until past 11 could be heard inside the room. The service was very good though. Everyone was courteous and helpful from check in to room service to the lady in the gift shop. Hotel needs a total overhaul - but the location is a huge drawback too.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average, expected a little more from the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Tootie84
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a gorgeous lobby, great bar area, but then you got to the room. The entrance to our room seemed very outdated, the door was very beat up, and had dated lock styles. It also let every noise imaginable from the hotel lobby area so it was hard to get to sleep. There were no outlets on the lamps by the bed so I had to dive behind the bed to even reach an outlet to charge my cell phone. Plan to use valet if you bring a car unless you want to park in a lot a ways away, and take the hike back to the hotel. Valet was $22 a night for us. The room temperature stayed good throughout the evening. The down comforter was extremely dirty (had what looked to be blood stains all over it), and was sandwiched between two flat sheets. That was a bit unsettling. TV location was good for watching TV in bed. Had the pleasure of eating at 560 in the tower for work, and it was FABULOUS. Beautiful view, great food, just be prepared for an expensive bill. Would much rather stay at the Omni or Anatole next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: StephanieJo
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here for a conference recently and slept very well. I chalk this up to following previous reviewers' advice: get a room 1) on the side of the highways instead of the train tracks, 2) not near the elevators, and 3) above floor 6 or so if you're near the atrium. So thank you for those tips, they're very good ones! The atrium is very pleasant with plants and fountains and an 18-floor glass wall on one side. A bar and two restaurants make up the other sides. Service was very good, and I loved it that in the lobby there are two computers and printers specifically set up for printing out your airplane boarding passes when you're checking out. I also appreciated the espresso shop which also sold beer and sundries. This is a gigantic hotel geared towards business travelers, with many conference rooms. It's a bit cut off from the West End by train tracks and an overpass, but it is possible to get out of the hotel and walk to some restaurants and bars. I did wish the hotel had better outdoor areas to enjoy, with benches to sit on - it seems a shame not to, with such good weather there so much of the year. The small outdoor pool area on the third floor had lounge chairs but was quite bleak, to quote a previous reviewer. No plants, cracked concrete - not an inviting place to hang out like most pool areas are. I was surprised to read in other reviews that this is supposed to be a 5-star hotel, as it didn't seem luxurious to me. It was perfectly satisfactory, but my room didn't even have a mini-fridge, which I've come to think of as rather standard. So I made good use of the ice bucket instead. It was very good for a business trip and definitely met my needs, but I don't think I'd stay there on vacation. I'd prefer someplace more cozy and intimate for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “So kind is the staff across the board”
Reviews.Author: ThePalHotel
Reviews.Content: My compliments to David Welday (Assistant Rm Exec), Chad Shobbrook (Assistant Food & Bev Dir), and the whole staff at The Hyatt Regency Dallas, Texas (Reunion Blvd), and I thank y'all! The trip was film biz related & a lil pleasure. The location, Down Town Dallas, the rm view, Down Town Dallas & Dealy Plaza, famous for an event that changed history Nov 22, 1963 (almost 48 yrs ago, to the day). Yet this Hyatt was not around until the 70's, the upbeat helpful staff, across the board, was & is always willing to accommodate the concerns and needs of their guests, and they all look fwd to the new renovations that will begin to bring this amazing property into a new ligh,t as a Dallas keystone hotel, for ALL events! I thank y'all for being on it! Filmmaker looking at Dallas locations for film (www.nativenewyorkerfilm.com)

Reviews.Title: “Wrong side of the tracks”
Reviews.Author: MrsTraveler23
Reviews.Content: A very nice 5 star hotel. Location was "wrong side of the tracks" literally. You had to cross the tracks to to walk to any restaurants outside the hotel. Friendly staff, nice workout room. Jacuzzi was not hot one day, but warmed up the next after someone complained. Pool/jacuzzi area was on the roof and kind of barren looking. Not quite up to Hyatt standards. Needed a couple adjustments to bill at checkout - were taken care of immediately with a smile and without any discussion. Went to Wolfgang Pucks in the hotel. It was fabulous (and expensive)!

Reviews.Title: “Everything worked”
Reviews.Author: llr43
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to the Hyatt in Dallas for many years. They've kept the hotel up to date and have improved the food considerably from the 1990s. The hotel and our room were very clean. Everything was excellent from check-in to check-out and the lobby-level coffee shop kept things moving nicely. Exiting to the freeways couldn't be easier and we were at Ft. Worth museums in 30 minutes. Valet brought our car in 5 minutes, almost the time it took to get from our room to check out then front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Average" is a good way to describe this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DrVicProf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a large community college conference in mid Oct. 2011. The location was fine and the conference facilities were appropriate and well serviced. Daily breakfast buffet was as expected (scrambled eggs, veggie eggs, bacon, potatoes, fruits and breads along with cereals and milk), all priced at a reasonable rate of, I believe, $18.00 - that's about right for buffet breakfast at a hotel like this, although I am not sure if this is a year-round rate for the buffet. My complaint - the room! With the exception of the TV, it looked like the room had not seen a renovation in about 10-15 years. Modular furniture, bed and easy chair were just plain old. The one persistent problem I had was the shower kept backing up while I was in there showering. Also the clothes iron was broken (this is big deal for me since I rely on the in-room iron do my own shirt pressing). They replaced the iron, but still had to make do with an iron past it's reasonable prime. I would stay at this hotel for business only (it's o.k. for that) Dallas offers many other options though for the family. Just my honest opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Texas Fair”
Reviews.Author: RobertandDiane
Reviews.Content: this is a 5star hotel, very nice rooms with great service, clean and very modern. They have a coffee shop that is great. There are three restaraunts and the wolf gang puck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: GS_VA12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a conference at the convention center. The staff was friendly and the hotel was in good shape. I would stay here again if I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: Alaskanomads
Reviews.Content: Knowing what a large property this is, we didn't know what to expect in terms of guest services, but we were pleasantly surprised by the level of attention and "going the extra step" the hotel staff gave us during our three night stay. From being greeting promptly at valet parking to recognition of our platinum status at check-in to an informative and helpful bellman and a very clean suite, we were impressed. Room service delivered our breakfast orders every morning within the time frame they gave us on the phone and the food was always hot and delicious. Housekeeping honored our requests for an early room cleaning each day and what a nice feeling to come back after a day at the Texas State Fair to a clean and enjoyable smelling room. We really enjoyed Monduel's - the bartenders (Mimi & Charlie) were a lot of fun to visit with and the bar snacks were delicious. We recommend the BBQ sliders. We will definitely come back to this property for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MMGq
Reviews.Content: Read what all the others have said about this place. I should have, but didn't - so I was terribly disappointed in my stay. It's a VERY busy hotel, long lines for everything! Front Desk staff are hit or miss in terms of knowledge of very basic inquiries. I'm a Diamond member and this hotel does not offer a Regency Club. The worst part was the rooms.... O U T D A T E D!!! You can tell some of the employees go out of their way to provide good customer service. I think the hotel thinks this makes up for the poor rooms - dirty furniture, mold in the showers/bathroom, stained carpets, stale odor smell. The first night I had a long dark hair in my bed. You can do far better at other hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindy l
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite spacious. I found it clean and the staff was friendly. Best night sleep I have had in ages!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Traveldenali
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times, and am a Platinum member of Hyatt's Reward Program(Gold Passport). Every other stay has been good at this property, but this time may be enough to keep me from visiting a Hyatt ever again. The hotel was hosting a large class reunion - and the noise from the lobby bar echoed through the atrium part of the hotel until well after 3:00AM despite numerous complaints to the front desk(and I was not the only one down there complaining). I was told there was nothing that could be done about it and "the bar will close at 2." I assume the bar did close at 2 - but the noise did not stop. When we finally did get to sleep - management called early in the morning to make sure we knew our room had been comped(yes - they woke us up to tell us that). The overall attitude of the front desk during the problem hours was horrible. If the hotel wants to host these types of events(which I have no problem with) they need to employ adequate security/help to make sure the non-event guests can get some sleep. While I appreciate the comped room - I would really love to have that wasted nights sleep back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Leah B
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel by the recommendation of my cousin who is going there on the 31st of this month. He is going to a conference at another hotel but said he wanted to stay here even though travel back and forth. I see why. Hotel was top notch. Even though they are in a transition of upgrades....who cares. This is what hotels do and you have to deal with it. Even though of its age it still was great. Mark and his wife are traveling with their 1 year old son. Its his first time at this hotel but has stayed at Hyatt's whenever he can. I hope he enjoys his stay there. I know he'll tell me. I thank the staff and if in Dallas we will stay there again. Go for the executive suite so you can have city views. Beautiful at night.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripTakerSandra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double bed room for 5 days, the room needed to be renovated badly, the wall paper near the door was peeling, the furniture had the doors removed off of them. There was really no place except the closet to put your clothes unless you like putting your clothes into drawers that are at floor level. The beds were very high, I felt like I had to crawl into bed and the frame would squeak and shift as you got in and out of bed. The towels and Linens are a cotton polyester blend which felt very cheap and uncomfortable. It looks like the room had been minimally cleaned for a while, the toilet was stained with a pink mold and the shower drain kept backing up. On the carpet I found two bottle caps, and part of an oreo cookie, and several gum wrappers, right at check- in. The location of the hotel is good, we had a view of elm street and the Texas book depository. I would only return to this hotel if I had to for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gigi F
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that I would highly recommend. A plus for me was the atrium which had glass elevators all the way to the top floors. The second floor has a large bar which is a nice place to socialize. There are also 2 restaurants on the second level and a coffee shop in the lobby. Unfortunately, the adjoining Five Sixty Restaurant isn't open on Sundays so I missed my chance to go. Although it's a comfortable place to stay, it isn't exactly in city center. I walked 7 blocks to the aquarium and although it isn't a long walk, I felt uncomfortable walking alone. I would stay again, however, because it is luxurious, clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, but showing its age... and MOLD!”
Reviews.Author: Bradley J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Dallas for a conference this week, expecting the same level hotel as the Hyatt Regency Bellevue (Washington), and the Summer Field Suites (Denver Airport). Upon arrival, I had a good experience with the bell and valet staff. Quick efficient taking of my vehicle, and guidance to the desk. At the desk, the effect of a packed house over the weekend became evident. While not totally aggravating, I was not able to have the King room I expected, even with an afternoon check-in, though I was offered the opportunity to move the next day. The front desk staff the performed my check-in had a pleasant demeanor, and set the stage for a good visit. The hotel has sweeping views and is decorated nicely in most common areas. I dined in the onsite southwestern style restaurant, and had both great food and service. I strongly recommend trying something new, especially the BBQ Salmon... But, this is where the positive started to fall apart... Now, I went in knowing that this property was due for a renovation. In fact, previous reviews have been followed up by the management indicating that they are working on a multimillion dollar renovation plan. My advice, wait until AFTER that plan is done. My room had loose electrical outlets, and one of the two beds had visible dirty linens. Further, the bed was not made correctly each day and the linens came apart each night when hitting the sack. The bathroom was not very pleasant either. I had noticed a little grime in the shower, but not until my shower on the last day did I notice mold. There was a fair amount of it, and both black and red mold... that was also the day my mold allergies acted up. I'm not severely allergic, and can tolerate mold (Don't need the hypoallergenic room for example). These allergies only act up when exposed to growing spores and those that are suspended in the air... Well, I noticed fresh growth all over the ceiling of the bathroom and the red mold growing on the curtain and in many place in the grout. It also looks like there are areas where the mold had grown before as the paint was bubbling in a few places and had been badly patched up in others. Overall, I would recommend staying at one of the other area properties. You will find other similar chains nearby, with much newer facilities and equally awesome views. This location has a fair amount of work to do, and has refocused my efforts on attaining the next higher status level with a different "h" hotel chain, instead of Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: AussieTJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here September 2011, it looks amazing from the moment you pull into to drive way and it gets better when you enter the hotel, the staff were really friendly and could not do enough for us, after we settled into our room reception rang to check that we were happy with everything have never had service like that before. They have a wonderful bar and once again all the staff were seeing to your every need, we ate dinner at the hotel and the food was wonderful and very well priced, breakfast was also well priced and yummy. Great location with under the road access to the train station, we used the train and went all over Dallas shopping district it also takes you right out to the Northpark Shopping Centre which in the largest Shopping centre in Texas. We cant wait to return to Dallas and will stay here again and again

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel right opposite downtown”
Reviews.Author: Josbob
Reviews.Content: We had an very good deal for about 400 dollars for 3 nights, with a high level room with great view on the downtown skyline of Dallas. This hotel is huge and modern with beautiful rooms, a large atrium and elevators on the outside. Location is excellent for exploring downtown. The sixth floor museum is very close and gives an very good overview of the assasination of JFK. Disadvantages are parking (best use valet for 20 dollar/day), expensive breakfast and the noise of the elevators at night. Get a room away from them! Overall a fine experience.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Madness”
Reviews.Author: Steven B
Reviews.Content: We came to Dallas for a family event and booked this hotel for one saturday night. College football games, baseball playoff game, Cowboy game and a convention combined to make it a nightmare. 1 hour in line to valet park both at check in and after our event. The self parking lot gate was out of order. Almost missed our plane waiting to get our car. Room was ok. Price was good. Breakfast buffet was mediocre to bad. Be careful of the date when booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good value”
Reviews.Author: Edward-A A
Reviews.Content: Nice in-room dining service, nice fitness center and superior staff service. The location, however, is not so good except it is very close to the train station. Nevertheless, I have had a pleasant stay here and have no complaint at all. As a side remark, the bar at the top floor is awesome but the only disappointing fact is that it is closed on Sunday!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay more than one night”
Reviews.Author: EricT113
Reviews.Content: Recently was in Dallas for two nights. Aftera long day of meetings and a business dinner, came back to the room only to find unmade bed, towels in the tub and no coffee service. Called the front desk and after saying "I'm sorry" with no other explanation, they offered to bring more coffee refils. After an hour, I gave up and went to bed. This hotel is probably good for one night (as long as you can sleep through the train noises!)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Namellor
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the highway, I found this hotel slightly dated. The elevators were very cool to ride to the top for a great view. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were excellent. Monduels bar was a great spot for a refreshing cocktail or a nightcap. The bartenders were very friendly. Overall a very relaxing hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Exterior basic huge downtown hotel Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Heartflight
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to other reviews here. Basic huge downtown hotel with landmark tower attached. Huge glass multi level from view. Nice looking. Lobby is nice , large and clean. Two escalators take you to bar restaurant level. Centennial restaurant had pretty decent food. The salad buffet was very well done and presented. The breakfast buffet $16.50 was also pretty well laid out. You can have eggs made your way for same price just request. Salad bar was $11.50 ( September visit) Dana great server. Large convention and meeting rooms so if you need a place for medium size gathering recommended. Easy access to elevators and yes, Glass on one side to watch your ride especially if on 15th floor or higher. Rooms ok, Need remodeling for such a classy looking hotel. Rooms as always in downtown areas small. Nice bath amenities coffee, coffee maker, Water available in room at $4.50 bottle ( Rip Off) I had view of City so was fun to film daylight and night lights. Restaurants close by in walking distance. Zenna Good one if you like Thai. and Haffbrau Steaks Market St. Never got to eat in tower at Pucks. Menu was $$$$$$. Over all nice , quiet while I was here, Great convention rate. The pool area is large 3rd floor but small and I mean small for a huge complex. I heard they were going to remodel rooms from maid so maybe next visit a higher rating. Heartflight

Reviews.Title: “So THAT'S what's under the ball in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: Dannyandcindy
Reviews.Content: Great location downtown, a short walk to the convention center. Spotless hotel with amazing service. Their restaurants, bar, and coffee shops were expensive and had limited hours. We enjoyed the atrium view toward the open middle of the hotel as well as the Dallas city view from our room. A light-rail station sits just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay with a very busy valet”
Reviews.Author: FrederickES
Reviews.Content: We went on NYE and the valet was pretty intense but still managed to churn out cars at a reasonable pace... the service was generally to the point and sometimes friendly but nothing to complain about. My favorite part (I feel like a kid) was riding up the elevator and watching, through the glass, the lobby from 20 floors up! Too fun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, lots of fun, nice room, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tampasteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for three nights this past August (2011) for her birthday. We were on the 21st floor looking out towards I-35. There was no noise from the highway at all, and the elevators were fast. Overall: Great hotel, it has been well kept and is in great shape. I cannot comment on the restaurants other than Wolfgang Puck in Reunion Tower (attached to the hotel). The property is an easy walk to several Dallas sights, and the light rail/ Commuter rail station is connected by a tunnel to the lobby. There is an observation deck on a lower level, I think level 5. You can go out and view the Dallas skyline at night - very nice! Rooms: Very comfortable bed with plenty of pillows, GREAT shower pressure, and nice amenities. Flat screen TV, desk, chair, coffee maker, and a large window. Restaurant: We ate at the Wolfgang Puck restaurant, Five Sixty which is in Reunion Tower. It is attached to the hotel and in a revolving observation deck in the tower. The food was great and the service was wonderful....the view was amazing! Pool: TINY! Seriously, the pools at most houses are bigger - and that is not saying much. The whole pool area seemed to be an afterthought. There were a few plastic deck chairs available, but the pool is basically on the roof of a low level floor and it gets FULL sun and is scorching in the summer. There is also an equally tiny hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ycmistro12
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. They did a great job even though it was very busy with a Anime convention. Rooms were very clean and housekeeping was fast and through.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: marcie5785
Reviews.Content: We stay here everytime we go to Dallas! Always a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsneed62
Reviews.Content: Upside: This hotel has been around for a long time but it was beautiful. I expected it to look dated and worn, but it was fresh and lovely. The rooms were very nice and it was really convenient to Five Sixty and other Dallas spots. Downside: 1. The customer service was a lacking in the attentiveness...we waited 15 mins to be checked in while 2 sevice reps stood around chatting. 2. Walls are REALLY thin...you can hear all your neighbors are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty standard mainstream hotel”
Reviews.Author: Messly
Reviews.Content: Nothing great to report on this hotel...or terrible. Basically pretty run-of-the-mill business hotel.
