Really close to the light rail lines (connected to Union station by underground tunnel), and 10 minute walk from some restaurants. They have a quite nice complimentary Fitness Center, with refrigerated towels (a nice touch). Bed wasn't great, but general decor of the room was pleasant. Room service ends at midnight which I was a little surprised given the size of the hotel. Was on the fourth floor with the atrium on one side, so could hear the bar below. On the other, outside my window was the train station, which also has freight trains going throughout the night, and could clearly hear their whistles, etc. So would suggest a higher floor or one not facing the train station if you want a restful sleep. I would be ok staying here again for work. If for pleasure, I would look into other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Items Stolen Out of My Room”
Reviews.Author: Jason R
Reviews.Content: Traveller beware!!!!! I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Dallas for business and had my ipod, headphones and watch stolen right out of my bag that I had packed in preparation for my flight. I left for work in the afternoon and came back at night ready to grab my things and catch my flight. It was on the plane that I realized that my things had been stolen! After I got home, I called the hotel and explained my things had been stolen. They said that they were not responsible for anything stolen in the room and that they would set up a claim with their insurance company. That was a week and a half ago... I still have not been contacted. This place clearly does not care about it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Come True With a Low Price”
Reviews.Author: drkphoenix21
Reviews.Content: From the time me and my daughther checked in to check out the people were courteous, kind and very polite. We booked a GREAT package deal but we did not have the voucher for the hotel instead of having us wait in the lobby, they quickly showed us our room with a beautiful view of the city with a glimps of the pool and hot tub. Everything from the food to the bar was AMAZING everyone you encountered with is nothing but kindness while at the same time making you feel at home. Beautiful hotel inside and out, GREAT BAR, Great Food, and a great location. P.S.- AS A RECOMMENDATION I SUGGEST YOU TRY THE DRINKS AT THE BAR, I CAN NOT TELL YOU WHICH ONE BECAUSE I TRIED ALL OF THEM, it was a vacation after all. & Don't forget the AMAZINGLY HUGE GYM, but don't workout when your drunk.Don't forget to go sightseeing like the zoo,aquarium and jfk museum. TO THE STAFF OF THE HYATT DALLAS HOTEL- WE THANK YOU FOR A WONDERFUL VACATION. We will see you soon to finish taking advantage of the pool, gym and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Texas Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for a weekend getaway and to attend an event at the convention center. We had never been to the hotel or Reunion Tower. I was a little concerned when the valet parking wasn't the smoothest operating, but it was a little busy when we arrived. The rest of check in was fine and our room was ready on time. They had shuttle service to the convention center that was never more than a few minutes away. The Wolfgang Puck restaurant at the top of Reunion tower was great. We did not have reservations but seating was available in the bar and the service was as good as the food. Our room was on the same floor as the penthouse, when we returned we quickly discovered there was a party in the penthouse. We called and asked if it would be possible to move and they were great. They sent someone to help us get our stuff toghether and had us in another room in minutes. This was the kind of customer service you just don't see much anymore. Eveyone we encountered at the hotel or restaurant was eager to make our stay as nice as possible. Keep that customer service attitude going.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Staff Needs some Training”
Reviews.Author: missH2525
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice. Both times were for 5 days and both were business trips. The hotel itself is fine. However, the staff is not. I was given key cards to my room at check-in. I went to the room and the key cards didn't work. I hauled my luggage back down to the front desk to tell them the keys didn't work. They acted as though I just didn't know how to work them. I hauled my luggage back to the room and tried again. I had a friend try. No luck. At this point I was very annoyed because the staff acted like this was somehow my fault. I went back downstairs and finally a worker went up to the room with me, and sure enough, he could not get the keys to work either. He told me the lock was broken and maintenance would be there to help. The maintenance man arrived and we discovered that there was someone in the room! They had accidentally given me an already occupied room. When I went back down to the desk, they asked me who was in the room and if I knew them. What in the world? I have no idea as it was their mistake. Eventually, I got a room. However, this experience made me not want to stay here again. I understand mistakes happen; however, the hotel staff should have admitted the mistake and helped me, rather than acting like I was too stupid to use a key card.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, helpful staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: coasterlink
Reviews.Content: The roads immediately around the Hyatt Regency are a little confusing, but the fact is that it's right off the highway and at the same time, right on the edge of downtown, walking distance to the West End eateries and right next to the light trail to venture to other parts, so though slightly remote for a downtown location, it still has some big wins. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating, As it was very hot when we arrived the water flavored with fresh fruit available by the front doors and front desk was a nice touch. The room was high and had a nice view of downtown including the JFK site. The room wasn't overly spacious and in good condition despite being a little dated, but otherwise comfortable. I'm not sure I understand the whining of other reviewers about getting nickel and dimed. Full service hotels typically charge for Internet and downtown hotel locations charge for parking and usually only have valet parking available, That's to be expected and the valet parking and bellman crew here were very nice and efficient and the vale parking price was less than in many other cities, including Austin and Pittsburgh.

Reviews.Title: “Only for reunion tower! Hyatt as a hotel is a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: interviewqueen
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Hyatt regency dallas. (my prior stay in May 2011). Both times I felt disappointed. We had a great start- valet very attentive, and carried our bags to check in. Then the trouble began. Hyatt is trying to be a "pet friendly" hotel, it has a "few" rooms which it made pet friendly. We had tried for two days the week prior to make a reservation for a pet friendly room. When we called, they said the manager was out and this person was the only person who could make it. Then we called central reservations, same thing, called and left a message with no return call. We went ahead and booked online and left comments about a small pet and how we weren't called back. We also upgraded to the city view "VIP" program. When we got to the desk, the CSR did not have a king size bed, then did not have a pet friendly room on the city view. Only left with the 4th floor (which we had already stayed at, before they became pet friendly). I understand they only have a few pet rooms available, but how about the fact that their customer service is so poor they don't even return your calls? I told them we could wait no longer and went ahead and booked reservation. If they would have called me sooner, i could have booked at another place, They are not the only hotel in this town. But it was too late! Checking in at 10 pm, where else were we going to go? we got stuck on the 4th floor. The rooms are a disappointment. Again being a 4 star hotel, you would expect everything to be modernized. The hyatt is an old hotel with some minor covers to make it look "updated." the furniture is so old, its probably from 1980, old wood, and the desk looks like something I had in 5th grade. I am not sure if the upper level rooms have better furniture, but I was depressed when I was in the room. At least this time the bathroom was clean. Like other reviewers, the previous stay, the bathroom was so dirty, with mold growing on the tile- needed major cleaning of the caulk. The bed was comfortable, the TV a large LG, no DVD. We had breakfast as compensation after I told them they were not the only hotel in town. The breakfast was good but on the greasy side. We ordered egg white omlets, side of bacon and coffee. Food was brought up promptly. We visited wolfgang puck 560 and def agree, it is the highlight of the stay. The food is definitely overpriced and the bottle of champagne as well but you are paying for the view. I understand. The food was very good though. I would recommend the bar area, where you don't have to make reservations and you can just plop down on the couches and enjoy the view. We had also asked for late check out and paid the extra fee. Upon check out, we scrutinized our bill, good thing! because they tried to charge an extra day of valet parking and an extra day of pet fees. Be careful and ask for your final bill. It saved us 70+ dollars and hassle of phone call to argue. All in all, go for the reunion tower/wolfgang puck's view, but skip the 3 start trying to be 4 star hotel and stay somewhere else. bleh.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Karena1stof4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a recent five day seminar. This is a beautiful hotel with many amenities. Staff was very courteous and accommodating. Be sure to ask about "incidental" charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: Rooms are ok, clean and comfortable. Older, but obviously remodeled and nice. I love the coffee shop because you can get breakfast but you can also grab a quick dinner there and take it to the room. They have made to order pizzas and prepared sandwiches, cheese and fruit trays, desserts, salads and more. Perfect for grabbing, taking to the room and getting some work done in the evening. The valet can get a little backed up in the morning, so go early to get your car.

Reviews.Title: “eWomen Network International Conference”
Reviews.Author: birdatman
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure to stay here for the third time and have enjoyed each and every trip to this hotel. Check in was fast and food service was well made. With over 2000 women in our group alone the hotel had not trouble in taking care of our needs. Although the rooms are in need of renovation, it was quite adequate. At check in I told the young lady it was our 31 st. wedding anniversary and we were given a upgraded room. We were given a free upgrade to a junior suite / city view, and it was very roomy. The view was very nice at night. Staff was superb and the 4 days we were there was without incident. The pool is not up to standards and was the biggest let down of the trip. Very smmal pool and very hot, no shade provided and not family or guest friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: mRebecca
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference for 5 days that was held at the Hyatt, with all meetings at the hotel. I was very happy with the service that the staff provided- everyone was helpful, friendly, and accomodating. The room was very nice and comfortable. The lounge and restaruant area in the middle of the hotel is very neat and the food was good. The pool on a rooftop type ledge is also a nice touch. They have a nice gym open 24 hours a day too. I would definitely stay here again. My only complaints were- you aren't really within walking distance to anything, so be prepared to grab a cab for a 5-10 minute ride to get to the downtown area. Also, DO NOT stay on the lower levels if you like to turn in early or are a light sleeper. We were on the 4th floor, right above the bar/lounge area and it was LOUD until about 2am each night. Defintely request a higher floor. There is a glass elevator that is fun and all the meeting rooms were perfect. Also, Wi-fi is $10/day, so consider this if you are coming for business.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite!”
Reviews.Author: tcarley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sante Fe suite in the Skyline side of the hotel and it was marvelous! Spacious and comfortable it suited our needs perfectly. Our bed was luxurious we slept soundly. The staff was so attentive and I felt they appreciated our business. Although there were multiple conferences going on the lobby never felt crowded or cluttered. I will return next year to Dallas and I shall surely stay at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Second time”
Reviews.Author: tulsadave
Reviews.Content: I would really like to like this place-it is difficult however. The rooms are very nice, there are connectiong doors to the rooms *at least in the one we were in) and we could hear every word the people next door said-and I am sure they could probably hear us as well. The service was good but the parking is a joke. They were very busy snd just getting in to check in was a nightmare. The hotel is close to most things but the big circle you have to go around is sometimes hard to find-and a bit of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauisnj
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference, which was being held at this hotel. This is a nice hotel with great service. The rooms are clean, comfortable beds, down comforters. We only dined in the hotel restaurant for breakfast one time, the rest, we dined elsewhere. Breakfast was just OK. Lobby is nice with a good coffee shop. Very near the "grassy knoll" where JFK was shot. Other than that, not much in walking distance but easy to get around with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Discrimination at its finest”
Reviews.Author: ArmySGT82
Reviews.Content: Didnt actually stay here, but tried to reserve the presidential and penthouse suites for a friend returning from a year long deployment to Iraq who is having his 29th Birthday. I am a platinum member with Hyatt and when I called the 1800 # they were more than helpful to direct me the downtown hotel. I got prices and sizes of the rooms, then asked to reserve the rooms (Granted I was paying $3500 for a 1 nights stay). She then put me on hold because she said she needed to set it up with the reservations manager. After being on hold for about 5 min, she says the manager wanted to know why I wanted to rent the rooms, so I told her, we were returning from Iraq and was going to Dallas for a vacation for my friends birthday and wanted a place to entertain friends. She says OK and puts me back on hold. After about another 5 min. she says she apologizes but the rooms werent booked in the computer, but they have a contract for all 3 presidential and 2 penthouse suits for that whole week. This was 2 days ago, and I was reserving for the 17th of September!! As soon as they found out we were Soldiers, all the rooms go from available to booked for the whole week. We've spent every holiday the past year overseas in a hostile combat zone, away from family, and just wanted to have 1 good night in the beautiful city of Dallas, and enjoy being in the country we've been away from.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay unless you enjoy getting nickeled and dimed!”
Reviews.Author: Njwesner
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is nice and the location is great, I would not recommend this place unless you enjoy having to pay extra for EVERYTHING! parking is outrageous- you either choose valet for $19 a day or walk 1/4 mile for $10 a day and no in/out privaleges. Plus, our last night, the parking lot was full, so we had no choice but to use valet- extreme rip-off. We were charged $40 for a roll away bed- no mention of charges when I asked for it or I would have asked for extra bedding and used that for my 2 year old son. Wireless Internet is not included. No continental breakfast included- instead you can choose from items like $3.50 for bacon slices or $8 for a bowl of oatmeal. We will never consider this place again the next time our travels take us to Dallas and would not recommend it to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to have a much better pool!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachWalk31
Reviews.Content: After traveling all over, I was shocked that in Texas a hotel would have such a terrible pool!!! I am a Texan and was truly embarrassed that in the absolute heat there is no good place to cool off and enjoy the sun!! Many parents also like for their children to be able to work off last bit of energy and enjoy the water... but definitely not here. The pool was tiny, it was on total ugly concrete, the chairs were terrible and the whole area was ugly. Hyatt definitely needs to invest in the pool so it is relaxing and visually enjoyable for the guests! Jeanne Sellers

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: aarisensmom
Reviews.Content: We were looking to take a little family weekend trip into Dallas for the 4th of July. We went on Hotels.com and found an amazing deal on this hotel. When we arrived we were overwhelmed by the location, size, and beauty of the hotel. Located directly across the street from Reunion Tower. Trip tip, the valet service is sooo worth it! Self parking is $10 everytime you leave and return, valet is $20 for the entire day and you can call the from your room to have the car ready for when you get downstairs. The property is amazing! Kids loved the glass elevators that soar 28 stories going through the 18 story atruium and through the "roof" for an outside view (not for the squimish) they do offer interior elevators too. Hotel was convient to the Dallas public transportation Dart system which we used a lot and were greatful for, they are air conditioned, easy to use and everyone we met was helpful. Be aware of panhandlers though. The hotel is very close to everything Dallas has to offer. Staff at hotel were almost eerily on top of things, example our 8yr old was squirming in his chair as we ate breakfast in the lobby, he was being silly and fell off his chair no big deal, within seconds staff appeared to ask if he was ok. You wanted anything they were always two steps ahead it was so relaxing to know they had everything taken care of and you didn't have to think about directions or best places to eat, the concierge was a wealth of information on to mention coupons and goodies for the kids. We loved this hotel so much that it will now be our go to hotel anytime we are in the DFW area!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay Here - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: McMomma5
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time staying here. We used Priceline and got this hotel dirt cheap. It is super nice and has the landmark reunion tower adjacent to the property. Union Station is across the way and we were able to get to Northpark Center pretty easily. Went out to the jacuzzi at night and met some nice people. My only complaint about the hotel is that the neighbors were LOUD & were constantly slamming the doors. I didn't lower my rating as this is to no fault of the hotel. Unfortunately, someone complained that my husband and I were being noisy and security showed up at our door at 10pm. Not cool...especially since I was dozing off and my husband was doing nothing but watching TV. Anyhow, despite the security mishap, we still enjoyed our stay. Would recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: emica2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here during the Memorial weekend for a conference. The hotel was very well decorated. The front desk was very friendly. We booked 2 rooms and requested a refrigerator for each room at the time of booking. However, only one room was equipped with a fridge. We were told that they will send another one to the other room but that never happened. The refrigerator we had was a small, old, beaten-up one so we didn't care to get another one anyway. The rooms were medium size (not very spacious) and looked quite outdated. The beds were comfortable though. But it's really nothing remarkable about the rooms considering it's branded as a "luxury" hotel. The swimming pool was very small for a hotel this size. It was a hot weekend - the temp was in high 90s when we were there. They served free lemonade at the lobby which was refreshing, especially for the people that just came in from outside. The front desk staff was very courteous and made you feel welcome. The location of the hotel was excellent - right in the downtown (sort of) and next to the DART train line. In one afternoon, we walked to the train station and spent a few dollars to take the train ride to Plano and then back. The round-trip ride took about 90 minutes in an air-conditioned train. It was relaxing and enjoyable. The kids loved it! We used the valet parking while staying there. Didn't have any problems for the first 3 days. On the last day, after we checked out and were ready to leave, we waited a long time for our car. Granted, a lot of people were leaving at the time, so we waited patiently for our car to show up. After 20 minutes or so, I had to ask a parking attendant where our car is. After 7 or 8 minutes, she came back and said she's not sure because "the record" shows the car has already been brought out. She told me to ask their supervisor who was standing a few feet away. The supervisor checked and gave me the same answer - the car has been brought out and waiting. But the car he pointed to is not my car! He ran to the key box and checked again and realized that they had made a mistake by bringing a wrong car. He immediately ran to the garage and brought out our car. He was very apologetic. He loaded our luggage and offered us some icy water which was much appreciated. Even though it took a while to get our car, I feel that the parking staff was really trying to make sure all the guests were well taken care of and they made every effort to ensure customer satisfaction. Overall, we were very happy with our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location cityview rooms noisy”
Reviews.Author: nyctraincntr
Reviews.Content: The location is the heart of downtown. There is a train station accross street great for commuting but cityview rooms are noisy on the lower floors. Rooms are dated but clean. Service staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are a little worn”
Reviews.Author: wkopp
Reviews.Content: The location, lobby, and building all scream for great potential but the room and service do not follow through. The room is small and worn without the amenities you would expect from a Hyatt Regency. The service was comparable to a Hyatt Place (good not great). It was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Typical convention mega-plex; dated rooms, mediocre food and service”
Reviews.Author: YHD
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a huge impersonal complex. Easy to get lost, and it is clear you are just a number. Special requests stay as just that. Needed a refrigerator for medical reasons - requested during res process and also called day before to re-confirm. Not provided when checking in. Called downstairs to check, and staff seemed more concerned with how to charge additional $20 for the fridge, but didn't show up until the next day when I complained in person to the concierge, who then personally took care of the matter. Kudos and thanks to the concierge. The valets easily get backed up during peak times. Only reason I stayed was for a convention - property is a convention factory, but don't stay here if you don't HAVE to, or can get by without hyatt gold passport points.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views!”
Reviews.Author: BalletDallas
Reviews.Content: Every time we've booked here, my husband and I have enjoyed an amazing stay! The rooms were always clean and comfortable with a breathtaking view. The food in the restaurants is amazing. We've gone for Valentine's Day as well as just small "staycations" and have had great experiences. You do have to valet, but what do you expect in the middle of downtown?

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice!”
Reviews.Author: murphymanDallas
Reviews.Content: I say "suprisingly" because when we checked in, we mentioned it was our anniversary stay. I asked for a couple glasses & some strawberries, and I also mentioned we brought our own champagne so we wouldn't need any from the hotel. When we came back from dinner we were pleasantly surprised to find there was a bottle of champagne w/ glasses & strawberries. And also a card from the from front desk (girl who helped us check in) that congratulated us & the champagne and strawberries were no charge to us. SUPER customer service. Also the Dallas city view was a nice touch. The sleep was a little rough because of the outside noise in the town area (elevators, people, etc.). But that was easily over-looked because of the customer service.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Customer Service the way it should be at the Hyatt Regency Dallas at Reunion!”
Reviews.Author: Gullah_Betty
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a five day business stay at this Hyatt and my stay was perfect and I don't give a "perfect" rating very often. From the time that I arrived by car, I was treated like I was the only guest there. Now, I absolutely hate to pay for parking but when I arrived, the valets were actually fun. The current rate was $19.00 per night with unlimited in and out privileges. They were quick to my car, opened the door for me and greeted me with bottled spring water. In the short amount of time from arrival to securing a bellman for me, my valet really tried to get to know me and to show interest in the purpose for my stay. He stayed with me and my luggage until the bellman came, making sure that I had someone to take care of me. The bellman was equally attentive and stayed with me until I checked-in. The reservation staff pulled up my loyalty card profile and added amenities that I had even forgotten that I was entitled. I didn't have to ask her, she just did it. That is was good customer service is about, anticipating the client's needs. The bellman was very careful with my luggage, not just slinging things everywhere. He was prepared with a master key and did not have me fumbling to find mine. He gave me safety tips before he left and pointed out the exit routes. Because of all the recent tornadoes that we have had in the South, the bellman made sure I knew what to do and where to go in case of danger. I had a Deluxe King Room with very simple traditional, clean lines. My bed had a white duvet cover, crisp white sheets and plenty of pillows. The mattress was a little firmer than I was accustomed to but that did not cause me discomfort or problems sleeping. There were two upholstered chairs at the adequately spaced work desk with in-room high-speed internet access. I did not have any problems with accessing the internet and not problems with interference or dropping connection. There was also a large upholstered sleeper chair. The 42" LG flat paneled television had a wonderful picture and great sound quality. The television sat atop of a large credenza with 4-large drawers and two open shelves for storage. I do not have an Apple device so I am not sure if I am describing this properly but the clock radio had a built in ipod/nano adapter. The clock radio had a night light that you can adjust the illumination. I really loved the bathroom because even though this property had been around a long time, it did not seem old. The bathroom now has double French doors with etched glass inserts. The coffee maker is in the bathroom which I do not like but since I don't drink coffee, that is really irrelevant to me. The pendent lighting, granite-like counter tops and the contrasting color scheme gave the bathroom a real sophisticated feel. There were high quality Portico toiletries. I can't say enough about the hotel staff. Everyone was excellent. I had really gotten disgusted at the level of customer service at domestic hotels but this hotel rose to the occasion. As much as possible, they tried to call you by name (I know, I know I had a name badge on but it still makes you feel special when someone calls you by name). They were so attentive, I almost felt like I was on a cruise ship. If they said that they would do something for you, they would do it or come tell you why they could not do it. There were a lot of us at this convention but they kept the common areas spotless. And they were smiling. I know everyone was working very hard but they were still smiling and made me feel very welcome. Hotel managers would stop you and ask if there was something they could do for you and would do it. They just didn't assign it to someone else, they did it themselves if possible. This hotel is adjacent to the convention center with a connecting corridor. It also has the famous revolving restaurant atop the Reunion Tower. It is now the home of Five Sixty by Wolfgang Puck. I did not eat here on this stay buy I have eaten many times before Puck so I know the view is spectacular. The convention meals and snacks we were served were excellent with lots of creativity and variety. When I would enter our dining room, I felt like I was walking down the red carpet at the Oscars! When I checked out, things went just as seamlessly and smoothly. I really did not mind paying the parking because I felt that I actually got something for my money. Some of the valets were in training but the managers were instructing them every step of the way to make sure they learned their job correctly. They opened my car door for me, gave me a bottle of spring water and wished me a safe trip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the atrium”
Reviews.Author: toocritical
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, excellent location within easy walking distance of historic Dealy Plaza and West End Historic District. Friendly, attentive staff, excellent food service. Unfortunately, there is one very significant problem: crowd noise from the second floor bar is very loud and easily permeated the walls of my atrium-facing room. The bar doesn't close until 2:00, and the guests apparently aren't asked to leave the area. On the night I stayed in the hotel, waves of cheers and laughter continued until nearly dawn. Needless to say, I'll ask for an interior room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: EagleDad
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights attending a conference at the hotel. This is a very large hotel that is relatively easy to navigate. The front desk and bell staff were very friendly, but the stay started to go down hill from there. My first room was located near the elevator and after one night of listening to the elevator grind by every minute or so I requested a new room (first time I have ever done that). The were happy to move me to a quieter room. Unfortantely this hotel has train tracks on one side and the freeway on the other so as noted it is not for light sleepers. The rooms have been updated and have nice furnshings, but they are not business friendly. The only accessable outlet is in the bathroom. If you wish to plug in a computer at the desk, you have to pull the desk out from the wall to access the plug. This could easily be solved with a power strip set up on the desk. The chair looks like a dinning room chair so it sits way to low to the desk. I am over 6 feet tall and still felt like I was at the kids table trying to work on my computer. Overall the rooms are small, partly due that the hotel has to be 25+ years old. I mentioned the great service by the lobby staff, but unfortanetly it stopped there. The bar/restaurant staff was slow and lacked basic customer service. When I ordered a bow of their organic cereal for breakfast, the water simply told me I could go make it myself on the buffet. I also purchased their business plan that provides you several upgraded ammenities including pressing a dress shirt - one for each day you are there. Unfortunately they are not willing to press 3 shirts (for a 5 night stay) all at once. They require you to call each morning and have the shirt pressed. I ended up using the iron myself. It also included wifi which was very weak all throughout the hotel. Overall this hotel has a lot of good, but also a lot of bad. Couple that with a $200+ per night price and it missed the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised..loved it”
Reviews.Author: chesterhouse3
Reviews.Content: Having read a view negative reviews, we were pleasantly surprised & loved our stay here. Assigned to this hotel while in town attending the NCAA women's basketball tournament, and so read reviews before arriving. We ended up on the 11th floor and yes, faced railroad tracks, but slept soundly at night & expect some noise while staying in any downtown hotel (chicago area hotels much worse with sirens, etc); hotel is within walking distance of many museums (6th Floor Museum, the great Dallas Aquariam, the West End restaurant area); and when we got tired from walking, can walk underground to Union Station & for $4.00 for a day pass, could take the DART system trains anywhere. Easy to get to the Dallas zoo using the train system. When coming back to hotel late Sun evening, restaurant and bar staffs on 2nd level very accomodating to the large groups coming back for a late meal after our game. Front desk & concierge staff always helpful.. we did get a great group rate which we appreciated and so overall, happier there than we thought we'd be after reading other reviews. If we ge the opportunity to return to Dallas would definitely check this hotel out again. (oh & received complimentary internet service in our rooms which was greatly appreciated just for checking attractions, etc..thank you)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but noisy and not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: ItravelaLotuKnow
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt at Reunion is a very nice hotel, staff was great, nice facilities - I stayed there for a week. But there are two significant factors you should think about. First, it is off by itself at the very west end of downtown, and most restaurants you would like to visit are a good sweaty 8-10 block walk away. Second, it is situated between a 12 lane interstate on one side, and the Union Station train station on the other, so there is a lot of exterior noise both late into the night and early in the morning. This would not be a problem if the Hyatt had decent windows and sound insulation, but it does not. I was on the 19th floor facing the interstate (when I checked in they told me this was the "quiet" side of the hotel), and it was noisy with the rush of trucks, motorcycles, occaissional emergency vehicle sirens, etc. I slept with pillows over my head. My colleagues who had rooms facing the railroad tracks told me their rooms were even noisier. So if you are a light sleeper or troubled by this sort of noise, you should stay elsewhere, as you will be very unhappy here. The staff at the registration desk apparently get a lot of complaints and comments about this issue, but there is really nothing they can do for you. I've stayed in hotels located in a similar noisy environment, but they had installed tight, double pane windows which eliminated the outside noise. The Hyatt needs to do the same before I would consider staying there again. And it is irritating to be charged $12/day for internet service when so many hotels offer it for free. The $17 breakfast buffet was good, but the hotel restaurants were typical hotel restaurants -- eat there only when too tired to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Razorbackmomma
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location, close to the West End, aquarium. and reunion tower. Be aware you can not go up into the tower without dinner reservations and you can't take the kids into the bar area just to look around. This hotel might be fine for business travelers, but not for families. There was a dance workshop going on and the hotel was full of tween girls and the valet parking took almost an hour. Nothing special about the rooms, and don't call for extra blankets, they will take almost an hour to get to you...

Reviews.Title: “When are you big hotels going to realize 12.95/day for WiFi is a joke.”
Reviews.Author: mhagens
Reviews.Content: When are you big hotels going to realize 12.95/day for WiFi is a joke. The internet is considered a basic utility in 2011 and it's almost like charging for running water. You don't even offer it for free in your lobby at your over priced coffee bar. Get with the program and stop nickel and dimming your customers to death! I would rather have stayed at the 2 star dumpy hotel down the block that gave out free WiFi. Anyone who gives this hotel a 4 or 5 star rating here is probably a senior citizen in town for the weekend who liked the sheet thread count.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant business driven hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londoncalling_11
Reviews.Content: It upsets me to see such mixed reviews on this hotel. This is a modern business-driven hotel that is as convenient for Downtown Dallas as you can get. It's a 5 minute walk to Dealey Plaza and the Sixth Floor Museum and 10 minutes to the West End where there are a number of chain restaurants and cafes. You're also right on top of Union Station with access to the DART tram which is convenient if you're visiting other parts of the city. Yes it can be noisy I imagine if you're on a lower floor with either the railroad tracks on the City side or the Stemmons Freeway on the other side with its extraordinary series of ramps joining three interstate roads together. However if you choose a high floor you'll be fine. I'm a light sleeper and I was fine. I would certainly recommend saving yourself dollars and hassle by parking at the perfectly good open parking lot at the bottom of the Hyatt Regency Drive. It's a 3 minute walk up a slight hill to the hotel from there and not a problem for an able bodied person even with 2 bags. The breakfast buffet at the Centennial Cafe was varied and there was also a choice of freshly cooked hot dishes. I had an Eggs Benedict and it was delicious. The staff were all friendly and helpful in the restaurants, at reception and guest services. The evening choices in the Southwestern style Centennial Cafe were not extensive but perfectly fine. It's not gourmet style food but not pretending to be. The Italian restaurant Parinno's Oven did a very pleasant Seafood Linguine dish. The 2nd floor atrium with the bar and restaurants is beautiful and the glass elevators (albeit not for those scared of heights) set it off to its best aspect. The bedroom was very comfortable, clean and despite a cheerleader convention taking place at the weekend was not loud and I couldn't hear people in the next room. Yes the hotel is dominated by business conferences taking place on the lower 2 floors and if you don't want to spend your weekdays with Chuck from the National Parks department then maybe this wouldn't be your hotel but I found it a very user friendly and welcoming place at a good price

Reviews.Title: “Not for Sleeping or Eating”
Reviews.Author: Reg61
Reviews.Content: This is an older property that has been updated, but lets put it nicely the soundproofing is woefully lacking. Be forewarned, if they tell you that you have been given a room with a view of the city...ask for another. What they are not telling you is that you are also facing the train tracks! Freight trains pull thru at all hours of the night, besides the commuter system in the morning and even on the 15th floor I could hear them. Also being on the Atrium side I heard the elevators go up and down continuously. Apparently one of them needs lubrication. The common areas are nice, the gift shop is well equipped and the snack bar is adequate. The Cafe is to be avoided. Both times I ate there the service was abysmal and the selection of food minimal (the dinner selection is worse but they have a passable buffet). I ordered the Bison Burger but was told that would take at least 15minutes....meaning the burger is so frozen the word fresh is not to be mentioned. So I opted for the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and my friend ordered the Chicken Quesidilla. After almost 20min, we inquired as to our order, it came out...mine was cold and dry, hers was more like a taco and had very little to no cheese on it. I complained and got mine comped, but still, I recognize it was a busy time, but this IS a convention hotel.....they knew this when they got into this business. Also the location, not walking friendly, dark at night and the main walking route to the West End takes you thru a dark roadway underpass. On the good side it is connected to the Union Station via a tunnel...just don't linger too long, the tunnel is musty and smells of mold. All in all it is a surprisingly lower than average Hyatt experience. Adequate but in no way can be considered anything but that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Derek_London_Ont
Reviews.Content: Excellent value â€“ room request met by staff - very clean room â€“ fast elevators â€“ comfortable beds â€“ in-room safe - fast wi-fi and parking but there was a charge for both â€“ underground tunnel to public transportation (train station - DART) â€“ easy walk to restaurants and (JFK) Sixth Floor Book Depository Museum. Great price from Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice... if you got a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: Crstobal66
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, business type hotel. It's huge, centered around a central atrium with a lot of glass, and several restaurant options. It's obviously targeted toward business/convention travellers. I got what I consider to be a great deal at $100/night for the "Business Plan" which included free internet in my room, full breakfast each day (sit down or buffet), and a couple other perks. Breakfast was very nice, though the cafe where it's usually located was closed for renovations, so they had the buffet set up at their Italian restaurant, and it was excellent. The room itself was very nice, and the bed comfortable. I asked for a quiet room, and got a room on the 23rd floor facing toward the back of the hotel (away from the train station). I would recommend doing the same. I paid for valet parking which was fast and easy. I sat at the bar one night and had an AMAZING cheeseburger (really!), but was a little disappointed to watch the bartender pour Cuervo when an order for Patron shots came in, and Smirnoff when someone ordered a Grey Goose and soda. (Heads up if you like premium booze). In conclusion, if you get a really good deal on the room, and you're okay paying for parking, then I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_Adkins
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family to attend a convention. For this purpose, the hotel was just fine. I would stay here again for this purpose. The location, near downtown is good. A rental car will be necessary for sightseeing. The hotel staff was helpful and informative, probably beyond my expectations for a large convention type hotel. I did feel "nickel and dimed" with the fees for internet service, bottled water in my room, parking, etc. This is probably not out of line for large convention type hotels in the U.S., but it always bugs me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bowl Game location but.....”
Reviews.Author: londoncal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at a number of Hyatt locations across the country, and this location would not be at the top. The service offered was both friendly and expeditious. Our room and bathroom were quite spacious, but (1) sounds from next door penetrated constantly AND (2) our room was above the grill/restaurant and we knew what was cooking when we entered our room (as opposed to outside in the hallway). We had a fabulous bowl experience, and this location was ideal for that and any other large gathering, but I would not recommend this hotel for the casual leisure traveler

Reviews.Title: “More of a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonSaint
Reviews.Content: Great modern looking hotel in a wonderful location. We booked asking for a room on a high floor to take advantage of the wonderful views of Dallas. This was given to us after having to ask for it again at reception (if the hotel asks for your preferences when booking why don't they read them) however when we got to the room it didn't have an in room safe. They managed to find us another room with a safe on an even higher floor so we got an even better view. The restaurants here were being redesigned so some were closed and when we went for breakfast the service was diabolical, 15 minutes to have an order taken (Yoghurt parfait and toast) this took another 20 minutes to arrive. The server said the normal staff were being retrained. We wanted to use Wolfgang Pucks restaurant which is the tower next to the hotel but this was not open on a Sunday and fully booked on the following day (even for a hotel guest) consequently we eat outside the hotel. I'd give this hotel an A for location and a D for restaurant service. Rooms are roomy, clean and comfortable but I can' quite believe that a Regency Hyatt still has some rooms without a safe!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and services”
Reviews.Author: tlhjar
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay. Rooms were comfy, but beds high off the ground. Food service very good... quality and service. They have a Coffee Post shop in lobby that has reasonable food choices, such as $7.00 loaded salads, $7 and $12 pizza that was very good. Not an easy walk to other areas, uphill, so cab fare adds up. Pool outdoor only; seasonal. Gift shop was very good... not overpriced and varied choices. I do wish that the restaurant offered more a la carte protein choices at breakfast. Only way I could get smoked salmon bagel was to order through room service. Buffet was too heavy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but pay for Internet”
Reviews.Author: fillmap
Reviews.Content: A hotel of this caliber should not charge for Internet (33 cents a minute). HUGE hotel with large public spaces. Top notch fitness center. Appealing rooms with very comfortable matresses and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed with hotel; Disgusted with the lack of customer service from Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: byersaj
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at a Hyatt again. This hotel made a mistake and billed the wrong credit card. I realized the mistake 3 weeks after my stay and sent them feedback on their online form. I received notice several days later that they had corrected the problem and charged the correct card. Problem was that I never asked them to make that correction - they did it WITHOUT my authorization. When I called customer service, i spoke with a Jennifer who was not helpful and a bit rude. (For the hospitality industry, I could not believe her attitude). When I asked to speak to a manager, she said none was available (in a call center? are you kidding me?) but would have one call me. Seven days later, I'm still waiting on the call. I called again today and the agent who answered said there were notes to have a manager call me, but it did not have my correct contact number. She too could find no manager for me to speak with. She said I would receive a call today. 9pm - no call. The billing mistake was minor, the unauthorized adjustment unprofessional, the attitude of the customer service agent appalling!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conference facility - OUTSTANDING front end service - Disgusting in room dining”
Reviews.Author: Philip_Herring
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency at Reunion for a conference this last week. Our group also held two private receptions in our suite during the trip. To give this review proper context I need to provide a bit of history as to how I have provided ratings in the past on Trip Advisor and my travel experience in general. If you note my other reviews you will see that high praise is well earned or I do not give it. There are too many people who rate standard and acceptable service as 5 Star / excellent. I use the â€œStarâ€� rating on Trip Advisor to demonstrate exactly what I experienced in relation to hundreds of hotels I have been to all over the world; from dumps in Eastern Europe, where we shared a BR and shower with the entire floor of rooms, to true 5 stars in the US, Europe and Asia. One star is a warning against staying at a dump â€“ 5 star means on par with the best in the world at up to $1000 per night room rates. With this in mind the Hyatt Dallas at Reunion has provided one of the best front end service experiences I have ever had with a few exceptions â€“ a definite and strong 5 star. See my staff kudos below for details. Food in the hotel was fair to absolutely disgusting, (<1 star for in room dining â€“ 2 stars in the restaurants) I ordered, from room service, the crab and goat cheese dip which was unappealing in appearance as it looked like soup rather than dip. Worse it tasted like warm vomit - no kidding, no exaggeration â€“ When I complained they did not even take it off my bill. Interestingly enough, I ran into another convention attendee that had the exact same dish and the exact same opinion except he said that it actually made him ill. Restaurants in the hotel were not good even for convention food. Hot foods were served cold and tasted like something out of a box that had been micro-waved. Fresh fruit had been over chilled, were watery and had chunks of rind on the melon slices. No excuse that they are undergoing a $2Million restoration including the restaurants. It is the hotels job to ensure quality food. Rooms and Environment: Furnishing were standard business class (a low 3 star). The Wolfgang Puck (Asian fusion) restaurant 560 was very good although the wait staff was slow, uninspired, and low class. The view made the experience worthwhile. At 50 stories up and a revolving view it was truly amazing. It is very expensive ($30 and up for entrees) but good food cooked properly. The view makes the higher than warranted prices worth it! A definite 4 star for the food and view combined- the General Manager and the Sommelier really added to the experience, they were knowledgeable, friendly, and professional. Location: The location was great. walking distance (15 - 20 mins) from down town and the west end restaurant district. Lots of excellent choices, hard to go wrong. Lobby: The Lobby was impressive and the elevators were fast and efficient. We actually rode the lobby elevator to the top floor so we could ride it down! It was like the "Drop Zone ride". I have attached one pic I took from the elevator from about the 20th floor. Details: On day one of a 4 day trip we arrived at the hotel. The lobby is HUGE as one would expect of a large conference hotel. Bell men were at the ready and the front desk was well staffed. We were taken care of very quickly by a friendly helpful front end. Several of our rooms were not yet available and bellmen appeared in droves to take care of storing our baggage. We were told that our bags would be delivered to our rooms as soon as they were available. With our check in complete half the group went to the rooms and the rest of us sent directly to meetings and or elsewhere. We also informed the front desk and concierge desk of our pending reception in our suite. They immediately set up a table for check in of our guests and spread the word of our meeting so that the staff could direct lost guests to our table. Unfortunately the staff was VERY large (more than a dozen at the front desk, at least 10 bell men and more at the concierge desk) and the lobby was ENORMOUS; see the photo with the 2.5 story water fall below) and not all the staff were informed of our event and several guess were missed in the process. We also had 4 sets of business cards lost while in storage. The staff (including two bell men, the front end manager and at least two security personnel) turned the hotel upside down looking for the cards and when the cards did not turn up immediately they had a 24 hour print shop reproduce new sets of cards in about 5 hours including time for two proofs. The concierge was amazing in helping us get set up for our first reception that took place only two hours after our arrival. Conference services kicked into gear and we had drinks on ice, light finger food, extra seating in the suite and a multi-site conference call set up almost immediately. They even produced a sign for our company for the Lobby and put our event on the Hotel lobby board without being asked â€“ just â€œbecause we thought it would helpâ€�. Avis was to have picked up another colleague that was going to arrange a rental for our group and provided the worst experience ever- lazy, uncaring, and with a poor attitude. In response to the Avis mess a hotel driver came to the rescue. He drove our colleague all over town trying to get issues resolved for our stay and participation in the convention. For three hours he did everything he could to help resolve issues. When offered a gratuity he replied â€œno thank, youâ€™ve had a tough day and I am just happy I could be of assistanceâ€�. WHAT! Incredible. We called on him time and time again during our stay and each time he was both an excellent guide and outstanding assistant â€“ gratuities later accepted. We also adopted a Bell Man / Concierge who was faster to respond to issues, needs, and requests than anyone I have ever seen. Without our asking, he had housekeeping make additional stops by our suite to ensure that it was kept neat and clean for our guests at all times, kept ice on the drinks throughout the day, and ensured that food was kept fresh â€“ no old unrefrigerated items stayed out for long enough to make someone sick. When I left to pick up our business cards, before I got in the car, our driver asked me if I had the data and or documents I needed to have reproduced with me. Since I was picking up I did not need anything but this level of attention to detail and care for my situation is outstanding. KUDOS! Although all of the front end and security staff were truly excellent there were two Specific Standouts: Victor â€“ the Bell Man / Concierge and our Driver Paul were outstanding. Equal to or better than my experiences with the staff at the: â€¢ â€œWâ€� Hotel and the Joule in Dallas, â€¢ Intercontinental in Prague, â€¢ George V in Paris, â€¢ Savoy in Moscow, â€¢ Peninsula in NY and Shanghai, â€¢ Willard in Washington DC. NOTE TO Management of the Hyatt: Please do not post a generic reply to this posting as you have done for others. If your reply is a standard â€œthanks for staying , sorry for the issues, better luck next timeâ€� it comes off as uncaring and unprofessional. If you take the time to reply please note what specific actions you will take to fix the problem ares described herein and to reward the staff that made our stay successful! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: Located in Downtown Dallas, this is a large, well run conference hotel. Every thing works as it should. My room and bed were comfortable, but the bathroom was a bit on the small side. The location near the West End makes walking to nearby restaurants and pubs easy. Getting taxis to more distant venues is no problem. Two small negatives: (1) my room had very few electrical outlets, and (2) the fitness center is way too small for the size of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: MikalaMarie
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Beautiful hotel (i.e. waterfall in lobby) -10 minute drive to and from the airport -Within walking distance of downtown (incl. the JFK shooting site) -Easy check-in and check-out process -Kiosk to print my boarding pass in lobby -Nice outdoor patio -Friendly front desk staff -Friendly concierge -Plenty of food & drink options including the 560 Wolfgang Puck restaurant. Cons: -Meeting rooms were cold, and chairs were almost unbearable for us all by the time each day was over, but I suppose that's to be expected at any conference at a hotel. -The bar staff was hit or miss. I had one great, attentive bartender the first night, but the second night my server didn't seem like she wanted to be there, and the third night my server couldn't be found. -Super expensive pizza via room service, which is to be expected, but it wasn't even good! All in all, if you can afford it, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION IS OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: shane560
Reviews.Content: My family and I went for the Texas-OU game. It's a great place to stay for anybody going to the game. The downside is that it was very loud with lots of partying all night long. We anticipated this so we brought our own fan to drown out the noise and we slept fine. The staff was very nice. The bar was very nice but the drinks are way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a conference”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiAnne
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the Hyatt Regency Dallas recently for a Young Living Essential Oil Conference. The rooms were great for sharing with one person, there were several restaurants available to grab a bite to eat and the conference rooms were well done for our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great place Down Town Dallas”
Reviews.Author: JNWARD
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Reunion Tower and we stayed the night at the Hyatt Regency. The place is great. The rooms have been remodled and the location is great. So many area attractions around - you are right in the heart of down town Dallas. The breakfast buffet is unbelievable and the service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel during college football season”
Reviews.Author: VAHHHH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hyatt for a conference and came in a few days early --unfortunately, I joined the hundreds of guests (I use the term loosely) who were in town for the Texas-Oklahoma football game. The noise was ridiculous in the rooms & hallways -- my FOURTH call to the front desk was at 3:48 AM. Staff was apologetic but that did not get me my sleep back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but bogus loyalty program check-in offer”
Reviews.Author: hipsterdoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a bad place for attending a conference. Choices for food are okay, service was good from room service and at the catered events. However, the online check-in failed miserably and the front desk staff was rude about not even trying to resolve the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Friends”
Reviews.Author: hattersmad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt on a visit from the UK to Dallas/Fort Worth area to see some friends, Found it easy to get around the city with the Dart and the TRE station right next to the hotel and also easy walking distance to Dealy Plazza and the West end. The Hotel was quiet most of the time apart from a Anime convention and then the place was crowed. The rooms were comfortbale fairly modern but nothing special but I would recommed the hotel and i personally would stay here again for any future visits

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME ......”
Reviews.Author: jmarino69
Reviews.Content: Made our first trip to Dallas from upstate New York ..We went to the Cowboys game.. We stayed here for two days on September 19th and 20th.. The service here was excellent from the check in until the check out. .All of our questions were answered quickly and courteously .. Outside concierge folks helped us with directions and getting cabs set up ..Room was neat and the king bed was very comfortable also nice good sized flat screen TV in room ..We highly recommend this hotel .. Dealey plaza isnt far away as are local restaurants and bars.. You will have to walk a ways to get to these places though..

Reviews.Title: “Request a "nice quiet" room.”
Reviews.Author: Harvestmeister
Reviews.Content: Typical large city 4-star hotel, super huge lobby. Dedicated coffee/convenience shop in the lobby, nice especially since there really isn't anything within easy walking distance. Check-in rep was very nice... started out my welcome with... "ah, Mr. Edwards, we have a nice quiet room for you on the 16th floor..." after which a look of concern came over his face, and he exclaimed "Darn... well, I don't know what happened there... another clerk just snagged that room, but I do have a nice room overlooking the city for you on the 17th floor." To me, a rooms a room, and I didn't really pay much attention to the "quiet room" exchange until a short time after settling into my room. To my delight, I had a room overlooking the historic Dealey Plaza, couldn't have been more than a couple of hundred yards away. Anyone familiar with the Plaza will also remember reading about the railroad bridge where they found the 3 "hobos" dressed in $200 leather shoes. Well, the railroad bridge is still operating and active as ever today. Seems a train came by every 10 minutes or so, and every 3 or 4 hours a really long and noisy train would roll on by, enough to make the glass windows in the room vibrate. So, that's when I realized the clerk moved me from a "nice quiet room" to a "room with a view of the city." Be forewarned if you are a light sleeper. On a positive note, the Eggs Benedict and home fried potatoes in the lobby restaurant were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Given the option- I would stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: lkenw
Reviews.Content: Cons: Lacks the service one expects from a 4-star convention hotel. Hotel is distant from restaurants and other downtown locations. Only real parking option is valet. Internet was incredibly slow-- even when purchasing the higher cost business connection. It was impossible to work effectively if one required any downloading of files. No free internet in the lobby to use while waiting for check in (delayed because of full occupancy the night prior). Pros: Rooms are good size and clean. Staff is friendly. Given the option- I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “business office lacks common sense”
Reviews.Author: Ebonkk
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place and I was treated well though my first 3 sets of keys did not work. The look on the young desk clerks face made it seem like i was a bother to her. That problem was solved by moving me to another room. The biggest problem was at the trade show I had collected 2 boxes full of cutting edge plants. I had carefully packed these plants in the boxes and delivered them to the business office. The young lady there said she would tape them shut for me. After she taped the tops down she turned the boxes over and taped the bottoms then attached the shipping labels to this surface. Which means these plants were trucked all the way from Texas to Georgia upside down. All the soil was shaken out of the pots and many plants were bent and crushed. Only a lack of common sense would cause someone to put the shipping labels on the bottom of a box.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs... and you will be treated like crap if you tell them”
Reviews.Author: Charisma79
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a work collegue and she had informed me on the poor night sleep she had. I asked her what wa the matter and she informed me that she had dicovered BED BUGS in her matress!!! She alerted the hotel staff, and they moved her to another room but would NOT refund or even Discount her money! They offered her a Free drink at the on site starbucks. NOT the way to treat a guest after they find bed bugs. PLEASE look under your sheets near the footboard of your bed. I will tell everyone I know about this probelm because you did not give her a discount. The health department needs to be aware! It used to be the nicest hotel in dallas... what happened??!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: MarkWing
Reviews.Content: We live in Dallas but recently spent a night as hotel guests in our own city as part of a wedding anniversary celebration. We had a room on the 21st floor facing downtown, and the view was spectacular both in the daytime and at night. The room had large windows all across the exterior wall, which made for a beautiful environment. From this location, we could see Dealey Plaza, the Sixth Floor Museum, Union Station, the Old Red Courthouse, the convention center and most of the downtown landmarks. The room was clean, well organized and pleasant. It also was relatively quiet, except for some occasional noise from the train tracks below, but that seemed to fade away. The staff at check in was extremely friendly and helpful. The only curious thing about this huge hotel is the swimming pool. If you're looking for a great pool, this is definitely not it. There's a tiny pool on one of the lower rooftops, where on a July day it was hotter than you'd care to experience. To say this pool is tiny is an understatement. It's smaller than a typical backyard home pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: CazzyB32
Reviews.Content: We travelled from England and didn't know what to expect. We were really impressed by the serivce and friendly staff we were welcomed by. The room we had was great it was spacious and clean and had everything we needed. The hotel facilies in general were good and we loved the easy access to the station and downtown area. We had a holiday to remember in Dallas and have told everyone about it when we came back especially the fantastic hotel. We read reviews before we booked and some didn't sound to complimentary but I'm glad we found out for ourselves just how good the Hyatt Dallas really is. Just shows you shouldn't believe all you read better to check yourself. We have been recommending this hotel to all our family and friends and would definitely use a Hyatt hotel again, hopfully they will all be of this high standard. We ate in the hotel on a few occasions - breakfast and lunch and each time was perfect. The location couldn't have been better, all tourist attractions in easy walking distance or a short walk to the train and tram, the front dest were extremely helpful in providing us with information and directions when ever we ask for help. The local restaurants are fantastic and for a snack and friendly and welcoming service you can't beat the 'bakery on the corner' and to top it all off you have to buy a Stetson in Wild Bills. Thanks Hyatt Regency for making our holiday something we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Close to American history!”
Reviews.Author: skapp02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Dallas for the STC conference May 2-5. The room was super clean with a modern bathroom. The desk workspace was a bit cramped and they are still using the bulky tv's, no flat screens in the rooms. The price for internet for a workable connection speed to work while at a conference is very high which I find to be annoying when you are attending a large conference that has rented out a good number of room for guests as well as the conference it's self. The elevators in this hotel are a bit frighting! The ones that do not have glass fronts seem to be missing sections of the kick board around the bottom edges and tend to have gaps in the wall coverings so you can see into the elevator shafts which is a bit unsettling. The price for the breakfast buffet is priced high for the quality of food on the buffet. However the prices at the quick service place called Coffee's Post has got just about every snack and drink you can think of. It also serves a full Starbucks coffee selection. The pizza they offer at Coffee's isn't the greatest but i've had worse from room service at various hotels. Over all for my 4 days of conference and 3 night stay, not to bad. Would have been more fun if the Reunion Tower observation level was open to the public but the short walk to the grassy knoll where JFK was shot provided a good fill in for site seeing close by.

Reviews.Title: “Was a great hotel until the convention arrived”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDoc2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to a corporate account. There are many reviews here talking of tired and dated hotel that gets overwhelmed with convention goers. My first day here was great. The place was not that busy, it was quiet. The room had been updated and was generally on par with what I expect of a Hyatt. The next day, however, the convention struck, and boy did it strike big. All of a sudden, my gem of a hotel was transformed into a loud, overflowing hotel that just couldn't keep up. The elevators were all jammed, and there was a line in the lobby just to get to them. The valet service suddenly convulsed (although we didn't have as bad a time as others reported). But the staff were great and the hotel looked ok. It is a good place to stay as long as it isn't overwhelmed with people. I guess it's just luck whether that happens or not. Nice gym

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very friendly staff, Awesome views!”
Reviews.Author: FilMart
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, both times top notch! Definatly get a room facing downtown, awesome view! A little noisy with the trains below but, very tolerable. Valet fast and friendly. Check-in was a breeze, very helpful staff. Quick elevators! Plenty of dining options. Bed was very comforable, very clean, and stocked. A real value compared to other hotels of the same level of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Baffled by the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: traumamama2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Memorial Day weekend, and we were both thoroughly impressed. It was immaculately clean....never saw a single "bug" or "stain", and we are both a bit OCD when it comes to cleaning. The staff was VERY nice. The rooms were beautiful, and obviously recently decorated. That mattress was amazing...no wonder Hyatt beds are legendary! We had a great view of the city, and the location in the West End was ideal. We noticed many people walking. The lobby is connected to the Reunion Tower where the Wolfgang Puck Five Sixty restaurant is. We walked over there Saturday night, sat in the lounge with a drink and watched the city from the revolving restaurant 50 stories up. Lovely! My boyfriend got a terrific price, and this hotel ended up costing him around $240 for a 2 night/3 day stay, and that includes 3 days of valet parking (yeah, you DO have to pay to park, and it's $20 per day. However, the valet service was terrific. We never waited longer than 3-4 minutes to get our car.) The only two bad things? First, the hotel is right next to the train station. It's a little noisy. Not overwhelming, but the trains do run all day and night. Second, the pool...it is TINY, especially for such a huge hotel, and it really needs to be updated. Ignore the malcontents who reviewed this place. I have no idea what their problem is. Overall, we loved this hotel, and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star quality at a 4 star price”
Reviews.Author: wegoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business for a conference at the dallas convention center. I'm a pretty seasoned business and leisure traveler and I can't say I would stay at this hotel again if I was in downtown dallas. It's not that I didn't have an enjoyable experience, it's just that the hotel did not meet my expectations for what a 4-star hotel should have been. Let me start - the hotel isn't conveniently located near any restaurants and it's a long walk to anything nearby. The room was comfortable but I was surprised by the lack of quality/clean sheets - I would prefer my bed sheets be a bit more white and you could tell the sheets were heavily used and reused. The room needs to be modernized as well - they were still using an old Television (and small screensize as well). Internet was a pain - their interface to pay (economy plan $9.95 for 24 hours) isn't exactly the best and the economy plan is slow as heck. I had to wait on hold for an hour with tech support to get it to work. Some good things though, the service was very friendly and they had a decent gym with updated equipment. The room was also very quiet and I slept comfortably (the pillows were very nice). I would only recommend this hotel if traveling for business - there are better options out there if you're traveling for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business in January, 2010. I wasn't blown away by the hotel, but I thought that it was pretty nice and it met my expectations. If you like big, tall, urban hotels with glass elevators and that business-like (but not necessarily "hip") vibe, you'll like this hotel. My room was one one of the higher floors and was in nice condition; the bed was very comfortable and everything was in good working order. I thought the hotel had pretty good style. I worked in the atrium one night and enjoyed the change of pace. I thought the service in the restaurant at breakfast was excellent, and the buffet was good. I was very impressed with the fitness center. The service at check-in was a bit slow, but polite. I had dinner one night at the Wolfgang Puck restaurant that is in the ball-shaped tower next to the hotel, and that was great.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated hotel, unless you like insects”
Reviews.Author: Texas_reader
Reviews.Content: What happened to the grand Hyatt Regency in downtown Dallas? It used to be a wonderful hotel, but now it's very mediocre, highly-overpriced, does not always have the friendliest of staff, and very disappointing. I stayed here for a convention and was extremely disappointed. There is an infestation of fruit flies in this hotel, especially in Perrino's Italian restaurant. When I asked my waiter if they always have fruit flies, he asked if they were bothering me. They are not only there, but there was one in my room and several around the buffet in the main dining area. I found silverfish in my sink. The food is very mediocre and very overpriced. This place really made me miss the DoubleTree. It is so much nicer than here. Also, my room was not the cleanest. I noticed that there were pieces of string and little pieces of paper on my flower. During my four-day stay, those pieces remained on the floor. I was curious if they vacuumed, and I can tell you that they didn't while I was there. Nor did they ever dust the top of the tv cabinet, which had a light coating of dust. The bathtub had a feeling of soap scum around the top of the tub. The people at Registration are not at all friendly, Even when I checked in and out, I did not receive one smile or thank you from them. Other areas of the staff were very friendly in the dining rooms, guest services, and concierge desk. The dining room people were very nice, but very lax at removing your plates, especially for a buffet service. Besides most of the staff being very friendly, I was lucky because I had a great view of Dealey Plaza and downtown Dallas. Also, the linens and bed were wonderful very comfortable. I was supposed to stay here for another night and have a relaxing day, but decided to cancel and leave the hotel. Why pay $200 a day for this service? I was shocked at the other reviews when I first read them because the hotel's website says it's the "cityâ€™s most consistent AAA Four Diamond Dallas luxury hotels." If that is true, it is a very sad state for AAA and their four diamond ratings. I have stayed in many four diamond hotels, and this is not a four diamond hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: Abirad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because the conference I was attending took place at the hotel. I should have stayed at another hotel close by, of which there are plenty within relatively walkable distance. When I checked in to my room, I noted that it was very dirty--for example, not only did the carpets have mysterious dark stains all over them, but there were nail clippings all over the carpet next to the bed. I called management and they sent staff to clean the room, but even after they left, I noted that there were problems like random hairs on the pillow cases. The next morning, someone from management showed up at 8:30 am to tell me that it was my check-out day. When I didn't answer the door, they came in anyway. Needless to say, this was unnecessary and made the stay very unpleasant. Further, the eating options were overpriced and bad quality. Overall, I would not stay in this hotel again. It's very disappointing, because I thought Hyatt hotels were supposed to be of very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Pass”
Reviews.Author: bindrew
Reviews.Content: For the price, the hotel could have been a lot better. The staff were friendly and I liked the bed and linens (hence my rating for sleep quality) but it needed a lot of upgrades. The TV reception was horrible and the Internet connection was sloooooow. Overall, it was an okay hotel to stay in but for the hotel rating and the price, I think you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you'd expect from Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: travelindiva96
Reviews.Content: It wasn't horrible and it wasn't great. The hotel definitely needs to be updated. Apparently, it's still 1994 there. The hotel is very close to the Sixth Floor Museum and Dealey Plaza. Not much else within walking distance. The tower was closed when I was there so I can't really comment on that..Overall, it was just and ordinary hotel..not what you'd expect from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and cleanliness were not as I expected given the price.”
Reviews.Author: sbecon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a conference. Generally, I prefer to stay at the conference hotel for the convenience. In this case, I wish I had read the reviews and stayed somewhere else. Even though I didn't pay out of my own pocket, I was disappointed in the quality and cleanliness of my room. The carpet had black stains of unknown origins. When I moved the side chair slightly, there was a wrapper and crumbs underneath. The phone was dirty and worn. As another reviewer pointed out, the tv was not high quality and it was oddly placed in a cabinet that made it difficult to see from the bed. I thought I might find 10 minutes to use the hot tub, but once I saw it, I didn't bother. The hot tub and (tiny) pool are located on a third floor terrace that was cement and completely bare looking over the freeway. Depressing. On the plus side, the linens appeared clean enough and my bathroom did not have any obvious grime. And the common spaces - the lobby and conference rooms - were in acceptable condition. Although most hotels have ridiculously expensive food, I think charging $4 for a cup of coffee in the lobby is ridiculous. (Not to mention my pet peeve about putting a sign on the bottled water in your room $4.50. It is tacky and absurdly overpriced, even the airport only changed $2 for that sized bottle.) But this hotel really has you captive. To get to any outside consession is a matter of walking 10 minutes to the other side of the train station. I made the hike to the Corner Bakery twice a day, but it was hard to find the time. I did not like the location and I thought it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expect from a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: rdkell
Reviews.Content: Was pretty dissapointed in general with this hotel. I travel often for business and usually stay at Marriotts. This was a last minute trip and found a cheaper package through orbitz.
