I figured that I couldn't go wrong with a Hyatt. First, the location is very awkward for walking around. You have to exit the property and walk through one of two tunnells under the railway system. They are very dark and pretty seedy. First night I walked to dinner and was threatened on the way back by two "not friendly looking" young men. This isn't the hotel's fault but something to know. The staff was friendly, especially in the labby bar. The bartender remembered my name and my drink on the second night. This was a nice touch. However the room left much to be desired. First, the television was very old and in a very awkward piece of furniture that made it hard to view from the bed. In any case I have stayed at Holiday Inns with 40" + flat screens and a "world class" hyatt for business travelers have tiny 20 year old junky televisions? Secondly, the bathroom was dirty. The showerhead had a ton of gross looking deposits, and the tub was filthy. I am also submitting pictures you can view. I ordered a sandwich one night from room service that was awful. Valet charge is $20 a day and there is NOWHERE close that you want to walk back from at night to self park. The business center charged me $15 to access the internet to make a printout. It was very tacky and nickle and dime for a Hyatt that caters to business travelers. When i checked out she asked how my stay was. I told her I was dissapointed that my shower was dirty, television was old, small, and hard to see from the bed, and valet is very expensive when there isn't really an alternative. Also, my room was opposite the train station so I got to listen to that all day and night. She asked me why I didn't ask to change rooms. I told her that I assumed the hotel didn't maintain a list of which rooms have filthy showers and which ones don't. She said that was a good point, said she was sorry to hear that, and gave me my folio, no discount was offered. With so many choices in the Dallas area I will not be back. It is too bad because I also will reconsider trying other Hyatt's when I have an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with world class service, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: tripcasey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to a business conference and stayed here. I travel for my job about 30% of the time and stay in hotels all the time. I would have to say that they have some of the best customer service I have ever seen, and I am picky. I think the extras do add up, like the valet and the food/bar is very expensive. The rooms are very clean with modern furnishings, but the building is really old and seems dated. Overall I would say that it is comfortable just ugly on the inside. Yes there is a train station nearby and you can hear it from the rooms, it did not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as previous reviews made it out to be”
Reviews.Author: jss_02
Reviews.Content: We came to Dallas for one night to celebrate my friend's bachelor party. We chose this hotel because of it's room options. We tried looking for a regular room at other hotels that would allow a roll away bed to be placed in the room to accommodate three males. Since we were three guys, we didn't want to all sleep in the same bed. Everyone would allow a roll away bed in king bed rooms but not in a double bed room. Our only other option was going with a suite which would most likely have a bed, sofa bed, and the option to bring in a roll away. Hyatt Regency was the cheapest hotel with a suite option. We had the horizon suite which had a king bed, 2 bathrooms both with tub/shower combo, a living room with sofa that pulled out to a queen bed and two large chairs, small kitchen with fridge, and a huge dining room table. This room has three entrances to the actual room off the hallway. Since this room was on the 3rd floor of the skyline tower, the dining room and master room have huge patio sliding glass doors that walk out onto a extremely large open air patio. This is basically the top floor to the parking garage. There are probably only a hand full of rooms that have access to this huge "party pad." The view of the Dallas Skyline is excellent. The previous reviews stated that the hotel is dated inside the rooms. While the room decor is a little out of date, the room was clean and very nice for the size and price ($179). You will not find another room in downtown that has the size, cleanliness, and price that this hotel has. If you want a spotless room with luxurious fancy fixtures that you will never have a need to use while you sleep, then this is not for you. Sure the televisions may be tube tv's and the carpet may have had a few stains, but the bathrooms were clean and the beds had no crap in them. Overall, a clean affordable suite for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I've never had to pay for a refrigerator before”
Reviews.Author: pinkshter
Reviews.Content: I had to pay for a refrigerator to be put in my room. Even small hotels have refrigerators in the room. WTF?

Reviews.Title: “Looks Best on the Outside”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Must be the place to stay in Dallas... I hear the NBA All-Stars will be staying here next week. I had a large suite on the 21st floor (2116/2118). Plenty of room and a large bay window with a view of lots of highways and cars. The furniture and decor were kind of drab and a bit worn, but while I was there they replaced one of the TVs with a large flat-screen, so maybe they are starting to redecorate. Service was generally quite good - no complaints. Huge conference facilities and tons of lobby space with a coffee shop. Room service food was adequate, but not spectacular. There's a bit of a feeling of isolation, perhaps because the hotel complex is so big, and because it's sandwiched between I-35E and the railroad tracks on the west side of the city. The West End restaurants, Dealey plaza, the JFK Memorial are within a half-mile or so walk (maybe 6 or 7 blocks). One downside - even self parking is not free.

Reviews.Title: “rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: slktravels
Reviews.Content: The public space of the hotel has recently been renovated and looks great. However, the rooms are in need of major updating. They still do not have flat screen televisions. Hotel staff were inconsistent. Some were great and others were down right surly. Food at the restaurant was great and prices were not too bad. I was in Dallas for a convention and they say you can walk to the convention center, but it's not the easiest of walks and you can run into some homeless people along the way.

Reviews.Title: “The 90's called and want thier rooms back!”
Reviews.Author: Davedrass
Reviews.Content: Staff great, lobby great, resturants great. Rooms las done in 92. Old school tvs in cabinets. TRAIN STATION RIGHT OUTSIDE MY ROOM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel (if you like the sound of trains running all night)”
Reviews.Author: Kahuna1771
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt in early December, 2009, and because of its central location, it was a good hub for the several business meetings I had in the Dallas area. The hotel is nice enough, but I have two complaints. First, self-parking is not a realistic option. It's a full block away, at the bottom of a hill, is owned and operated by the City of Dallas, and does not offer "in and out" privileges. As a result, you're pretty much stuck with valet parking, which is both expensive and inconvenient, especially when the hotel is crowded. Second--and this was a big deal during my stay--the hotel is adjacent to a large train station, and the trains ran all night. I'm not a particularly light sleeper, but I woke up several times during the night to the sound of train horns. When I checked out, I mentioned to the clerk that the trains kept me awake, and I suggested that I should have stayed on a floor higher than the 11th. She responded that it wouldn't have made any difference because she's received similar complaints from guests staying on the 20th floor and up. The upside was that I got a good rate through Expedia (about $125/night), but in retrospect, I would have paid more to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “What a Mess”
Reviews.Author: Foreignwife
Reviews.Content: There were two conventions going on the weekend before Thanksgiving and it took over an hour of waiting in traffic to get our car into valet and all surrounding lots were full. The place was a madhouse with kids everywhere and lines for parking 30 deep. Room was not serviced by 5pm on the third day and management suggested it was our fault even though the Privacy sign was not out. They do have an excellent work out facility but that is the only positive thing I can say about this place. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Traffic jams for Check-in are a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: traclift
Reviews.Content: Long ago I stayed at the Hyatt in Chicago and I was VERY impressed, and I guess I expected the same in Dallas--unfortunately, it wasn't the same. Whoever dreamed up the process of checking in obviously had no experience with the word "organization". It was possible to park a short distance away for $10 and carry your luggage to the check-in desk, but if you needed to leave for any reason, you were charged $10 each time you returned. For this reason, we opted Hyatt's valet parking for $20/day which meant whenever we needed to leave: 1. Wait in line to turn in your ticket to the valet desk 2. Wait in line while your vehicle was retrieved (I waited about 25 minutes since it was so busy on Saturday night). 3. Give the valet a tip (optional, but you know how that goes). 4. Once you return, wait in a traffic jam 20-30 minutes to simply return your vehicle to the valet (it was backed up for about a block when I returned, hence the aforementioned lack of organization). Add to that the constant noise of the trains (the tracks are immediately adjacent to the Hyatt) and there were freight trains, Amtrak passenger trains, and the local DART for local transportation, and they all enjoyed blowing those horns. Perhaps if you get a room on the opposite side of the train tracks, the noise won't be so noticeable. And what's with the relic TV, Hyatt? The one in our room must have been at least 15 years old. It's way past time to update to the HD's that have been around for a number of years now (you know, the same way your competitors such as the Hilton and other hotel/motel chains have already done?) On the upside, I have to say the room was spacious and very clean. All of the employees were courteous and helpful. I won't mention the food or the location as other reviewers have already hit on that. I would recommend with one caveat--if you can get a really good discounted price, but certainly not if you have to pay the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Regency was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: blsntx
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the fifth floor and we heard no trains or airplanes which some people complain about. Actually once we were in the room we heard nothing from ourside the room and I usually have to sleep with ear plugs. Everyone was pleasant and eager to please us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but didn't exceed my expectation”
Reviews.Author: XtinaY
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Dallas for work so I decided to spend the weekend there as well. The hotel is right there in downtown area. I took a shuttle (it's nice and quick, so much cheaper than taking a cab with easily cost 40 bucks. The shuttle cost 20 bucks only) and it only take ~ 20 minutes to get to the hotel. The hotel was having a conference so it was pretty busy. Reception was very nice and friendly. Room was pretty good, but I did find dirty spots on the carpet. Complains are, first of all it's not as glamorous as I thought. Also you can take the elevator to any floors without a hotel key card. It cost a lot to park your car there (I think 19 bucks)? However good thing is that there is another parking lot down the hill that cost only 10 bucks (however no in and out privilege). Internet cost you 10 bucks for 24 hrs. Location: I went during a rainy weekends and I hope that explains why there's NO ONE downtown. I think the location is in a financial district so it's very quiet during weekends. I left on monday morning and finally see some people going to work. Nearby: Went to 6th floor museum. I wasn't very interested at the beginning but I did it and it was a good experience after all. West End is very close to the hotel as well and I ended up visiting that area 4 times in 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: Won this on Priceline for $50 a nite, so took the sting out of paying the $19 parking fee. Let's face it, any major chain in any major city is going to nickel and dime you to death, so it should be no surprise. (Parking fee here is a double whammy, because there is really nothing much within walking distance). I'm a smoker so I was surprised to find out that they have a smoking floor, the 20th floor, so that's a big plus for me. Also the room was huge with a great view of downtown Dallas. I must say that I arrived on a Saturday afternoon and it was complete chaos at the entrance, so I was not looking forward to checking in. However, within 5 minutes my car was taken and I was checked in. Good work Hyatt! ALSO a nice touch, on weekends thay discount the room service prices. Nice! To encourage this kind of behavior, I took advantage of it. They also have a really good free gym. Way above average for Hotel Gyms. I would recommend this place if you can get a good rate. Had a great room, good service, but beware of all the charges. I think if I had to pay a full rack rate, I might look for some place that was in a more walkable location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but you can hear the planes”
Reviews.Author: ciabella50
Reviews.Content: Had to stay near the airport, so this was very convenient. But, know you have to take the airport shuttle to get there (its not connected to the airport like the other Hyatt) and it is noisy. You do hear the planes taking off. Food is surprisingly good. Hotel staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Meeting Venue - Meeting Planners MUST SEE”
Reviews.Author: Winnie9277
Reviews.Content: This venue was a dream from a meeting planners standpoint. The space was great and the staff was AMAZING. Wish every city had the Hyatt Regency Dallas staff in it!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Romantic Evening”
Reviews.Author: goinplaces2
Reviews.Content: Want to have a romantic evening downtown? Beautiful view and friendly, professional staff - but, it stopped there. The room: If the roar and honks of trains roaring by your room soothes you, then this is your place. Amenities: The lotion, shampoo, and conditioner supplied had a fragrance that will be with me forever - not in a nice way. They must have gotten a great deal on the "vanilla ginger". Sounds good, right? Ummmmm not good. It haunts me. The hair dryer could have dried the fur of a small rodent. I have very thin fine hair that can dry in 90 seconds at home. It took me 15 minutes to dry my hair. No need to exfoliate, the shower will take care of that. It was like needles coming at you at near boiling-point temperatures. I wanted an exceptional hotel experience for my husband's 50th birthday and got a mediocre one at best

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not as nice as the Hilton Anatole”
Reviews.Author: skidz7
Reviews.Content: For the second time this year I had a weekend work/pleasure trip to Dallas. Last time I stayed at the Hilton Anatole, and this time I stayed at the Hyatt Regency, some of my comments are comparisons. I got a great deal on this room at $50/night + tax. They get you on the parking, though....$20 per day for Valet. (Normally I'd self-park, but if you do that you pay $10 every time you exit the lot....no thanks) The valet service can be charged to your room but it is managed by a separate company. Be sure you check your charges carefully upon check-out...the valet company tried to charge us for an extra day's worth of parking. The front desk clerk quickly caught & corrected this issue. The desk clerk was pleasant and happy to accomodate our request to be in the tower and on a higher floor. (She also gave us a room with a great view). Other front desk staff were also pleasant, as was the concierge. The Fitness Center in this hotel had some of the nicest equipment I've seen at a hotel fitness center, and is open 24/7. The 3rd floor rooftop pool was small but we didn't do any swimming. The room we got was non-smoking and had 2 double beds. The room seemed small and the furniture was just ok...seemed somewhat dated. The bathroom was nice and we had excellent water pressure even on the 23rd floor. There are train tracks that run right by the hotel and yes, you'll probably hear trains at some point during the night. They weren't loud enough to wake me up but might be a problem for light sleepers. I like to sleep with the room cold, so the first thing I did when we got to the room was to turn the thermostat down to about 65 degrees. Even with the thing set on high the room never got below about 68...usually hovering around 70. The ac was also very quiet which can be a bad thing because it doesn't drown out any other noise. Sounds in the hall & in adjacent rooms weren't muffled well in this hotel. I had planned to at least stop by the Wolfgang Puck restaurant or lounge but never made it up there so I can't comment on that. Overall I was pleased with the hotel, but considering that our stay at the Hilton Anatole was only $10 more per night, I'd much rather stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: acballinger
Reviews.Content: I actually got a great price for this hotel on priceline. I stayed 4 nights at $60 a night. I was very excited until I found out the parking situation. I was told I could either pay $10 each time I entered the garage or $20 a day for valet. the room was small and outdated. the air conditioner never cooled down the room enough despite constantly running. the walls are also very thin and I could always hear the people in the next rooms. the closet was very small as well. I was surprised to find the beds were the most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept in. the hotel was close to the highway but not much else I would be interested in. I think the ultimate disappointment was the pool. it is only 5 ft deep and very very tiny. I recommend the Hilton Anatole. my visit there in april 2009 was amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hulahunny
Reviews.Content: I had heard so many nice things about this hotel and trusted the opinion of the person who raved about it. I must say, it was not quite what I was expecting. Now let me start by saying that I was there for 7 nights and got a screaming deal on the Hyatt website. The rate was $67 for four of the nights and about $80 for the other three. This was direct with Hyatt and not a third party booking service. The hotel was very crowded on our arrival and during the entire stay for that matter. Despite the fact that we have a Diamond status with Hyatt, we had a very small, outdated room, no upgrades available. The television old, the furniture was dinged and worn looking , the bed was very uncomfortable (unusual for Hyatt), the linens were thin, the air didn't work great and the closet was extremely small. In our reservation, we also requested non-feather bed pillows and comforter due to allergies and it took them two days to get that right. I think the most disappointing thing of all was that they no longer have a regency club. My source had told me that this property had one of the best regency clubs around. Evidently, it closed earlier this year. As a result, breakfast was served in the restaurant and complimentary to Diamond members. It was okay and we only ate there one time. Some other items to note; the hotel is not within walking distance to any real restaurants or activities. It is conveniently located near the freeways and is easy to access if you are traveling around the Dallas area. The parking was about $20 per day for valet and what seemed odd was that each day when returning our vehicle we had to get a new ticket and start all over, rather than keep the same one for our entire trip. This seemed to waste time, particularly when the hotel was so busy. The pool resembles a large bath tub and is located on the roof on the 3rd floor. Okay if you want a quick cool down, but not a good place for families. Not sure if I would stay here again. There were a lot of negatives and the only true positive was the price. Don't know if that outweighs the downside. I think on my next trip to Dallas I would opt for staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Renovation”
Reviews.Author: KatMan1112
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Dallas for 30 years and at one time this was THE place downtown. We decided to go 4th of July and for $99 it was really nice. They just finished a big renovation and right next door is the Reunion Tower with a new Wolfgang Puck restaurant at the top. Think about it - the place is on the opening of the original show "Dallas", so it's been around for a while and shows age in some areas (1978? 1979?) The kids loved it - something different to do. The ultimate vacation hotel for a family coming from out of town? Probably not, but a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel - but could be much better”
Reviews.Author: whr975s
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel is impressive - although it needs some lights and a sign in my opinion. The lobby is nice, but the rooms are not so hot. The TV's are very outdated and the workspace is TINY and has a very hard uncomfortable chair. The concierge wasn't very informative, he didn't know directions, cab phone numbers, approximate cost of a cab ride, etc. He actually referred us to the valet area for advice. Isn't that HIS job?! The parking is a bit ridiculous. I understand being downtown that you pay for parking, but the self parking is down a hill and across the street and doesn't have in and out privileges. So if you intend to drive your car at all you're pretty much forced into $19 per day valet. The people were overall nice and the the hotel is clean, but I just didn't feel that it is up to Hyatt standards. The location is good - we could walk to the West End.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo-TX
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hyatt Regency Dallas in mid-April for three nights. The purpose of our stay was for a tournament held at the nearby convention center. Customer service was excellent. Hyatt Gold Passport members have a dedicated line for check-in and customer service. Room size was adequate - not too small, not overly large. Rooms were modern and well furnished. Room was kept clean. Television channel selection was good, particularly for children. Breakfast buffet in the downstairs restaurant was good, albeit a bit overpriced. Hotel is within walking distance of the convention center (about 8 blocks). The area around the hotel is obviously urban. Some areas are a bit dicey at night. Swimming pool is small for a hotel of this size and standard. Valet parking is available and provides covered parking. Otherwise, paid parking is down the hill in a fenced-in lot that does not provide "in and out" privileges. Overall, the hotel is quite nice. Service was excellent. The hotel is quiet. Downside is the lack of free "in and out" parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth more than $50 per night”
Reviews.Author: EmceeBee22
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on priceline, so I can't very well complain about the quality since I got a really good deal. However, this hotel basically sucks. The location is decent, the staff was friendly, and overall, I had a decent experience. However, there were a few too many "cons" with this hotel. For one, our shower made this awful/high-pitched sound when the water was running. Sounded like a kettle going off and I actually had a ringing in my ear for about 15 mins afterward. Also, the room service was a joke. Most overpriced food I've ever seen/had in my life. The pool is AWFUL, don't even let it factor into your decision at all. The only "roof top" thing about it , is that its near the pipes and some cement walls on the roof of the hotel. And it fits maybe 10 people, if everyone is OK with being uncomfortably close. Also, the parking situation is annoying. They charge $19 for valet to park your car, but you can pay $10/day to park down the hill, across the street. We saw quite a few people walking to/from their car/hotel, but it was slightly frustrating that there isn't even an option for free parking in the area. If you have a chance to stay here because of a convention or something that brings you to the specific area, then I'm sure it'll work out well for you. But for someone travelling to Dallas as a tourist? I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: txtravelagent
Reviews.Content: Our bathroom was not clean (use your imagination), lobby was hot hot hot. The hotel is very worn and very dated. Elevators had trash in them. Breakfast was less than desirable. I got a very inexpensive rate but if I hadn't, I would have asked for compensation. Internet was 10. a night. Valet parking was 20.00 per night too The cleaning staff that had to come clean the bathroom was very nice and they arrived in a hurry. As a travel agent, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A busy hotel filled with convention-goers. This hotel lacks intimate details.”
Reviews.Author: linensandbooks
Reviews.Content: There was a Pro Scout Convention going on, which made the hotel very crowded. there were teens everywhere (which is a minus, for me personally). This hotel is connected to the Convention Center, so beware, it wll be a busy hotel. If you will be attending a convention, then this is your place. We were forewarned that the valet is slow. It looked slow with a crowd of people waiting around for their cars. I'm glad I parked at the lot down the street. The front desk attendant checked me in quickly, was very friendly. Other than that, I didn't come in contact with many staff members. I recently stayed at a Hyatt Regency in Austin and I loved it. I had the same expectations for this hotel, but was very disapointed. This room was rather bland, as if they quickly fitted and furnished the room for convention goers (as opposed to a hotel that would take the time to make the room friendly for business travelers or for romantic getaways). The entire room had one accessible plug. We had to unplug a lamp to use it. The room did have a great view. The elevators were glass elevators, so as you traveled up, you could see the lobby and outside. We ate at the Italian restaurant in the hotel and that was the typical bland over priced hotel food. We were even given two cards for complimentary deserts to this restaurant. I couldn't even go past the first bite on the desert (and I LOVE deserts!).

Reviews.Title: “I would rather stay @ a Holiday Inn & pay the same rate!”
Reviews.Author: wanicad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hyatt Regency in Dallas because my daughter was invited to a ProScout Convention & it was convienent but if I would not have chosen this hotel otherwise! 1st, wifi is not free & what's up with that? Its obvious this is a business hotel! My master bedroom at home is bigger than the 2 queen bed room that we had which did NOT include microwave or refridgerator & I could not figure out the little coffee pot in the restroom (& neither could the staff)...My home pool is also large & the $4.50 Augafina Water is just ridiculous! The air conditioning unit is the quality of a motel 6 AC & overall the room sucked There are a few resturant in the hotel but there quality of food is less than average with prices of a 5 star restaurant & there staff was mediocre at best! Honestly, if my company was paying for this trip then whatever, but I would never stay at the Hyatt Regency on my own dime ( I would need too many)! Who wants to pay $25 daily to valet or $10 daily + reentry fee to park across the intersection. Oh & the fitness center was not open (but I am sure there was an extra fee to access it) &&&&& there is no cable in the room, only 10 channels & I brought teenagers, not a good scenerio!!!&&&&& the restaurants down the intersection closes at damn 3:00 pm on a Saturday (my daughter was mad as hell)...whats up w/that! Perks, located centerally & the lobby w/it's water feature & plant life is nice but otherwise I was very dissappoint & felt robbed of my hard earned money! I do NOT recommend the Hyatt Regency & I will never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Subpar for Hyatt and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: StLouis01
Reviews.Content: Disappointed considering the cost of rooms and it being a Hyatt. Stayed here for a conference but would never pay to stay here out of pocket as it's not worth the price. I stayed here for two nights and although my room/bathroom was cleaned after the first night, I was not given new supplies for the bathroom which has never happened to me in a hotel. I realized this as I was getting to shower that I had two drops of shampoo left. As far as the rooms, plug points are almost non-existent. I had to unplug the clock to charge my laptop. The internet is extra $10 a day, which is common in other hotels, but shouldn't be the case for the upper end hotels. Small regular TV and no refreshments other than water even available for purchase. In all, it's definitely an okay hotel for less than $110 a night but not for what they are charging (my room's charge was $250 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention to the suggestions in the reviews and your room will be great.”
Reviews.Author: ringing8
Reviews.Content: I was attending a professional meeting at the Convention Centerand was assigned this hotel, which was our headquarters hotel. It was close to the Conv. Center, but we had shuttles, so I am not sure about the walk. Suggestions in the reviews were great. I asked for a room away from the railroad tracks and not on the atrium. Someone also said to ask for an even numbered room, but I'm not sure if that is true. The front desk person was great and had no problem with the requests. They even had the changes that I had called in to Hyatt Reservations. We were assigned to room 2126 and it was on a corner and it was a good size, clean, and quiet. The front desk person even called to see how the room was. Everyone else was very courteous and helpful. The concierge asked how our stay was and was interested in the reviews, etc. He did say that they were refurbishing all the rooms tower by tower and floor by floor. There were lots of elevators and they came quickly. We flew Southwest in to Love field which is closer and smaller than DFW but I think that was better, except we could not get a non-stop flight in to Dallas. The concierge told us that when DFW Airport was built, a law was passed that there could be no nonstop flights into or out of Love Field to reduce competition. That law will expire in 3 years, so flights should improve. We went to convention related parties at Gilley's, House of Blues and in the Reunion Tower in the Hyatt. All were loud, but fun.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a hotel in the airport, this isn't”
Reviews.Author: IndianaLibraryGirl
Reviews.Content: Our airline connections required an overnight in Dallas. We choose the Hyatt Regency because the website said it was in the airport which is rather deceptive wording. The Grand Hyatt is actually in the airport but the Regency is on the airport grounds--you have to take a shuttle. Since our purpose in choosing a hotel in the airport was convenience we didn't get what we paid for. Our specific room was at the end of a hall, the stairwell door rattled and banged all night. The high point of the stay was the hotel restaurant where we had very attentive service by the amazing Allen who is the personification of customer service. If you have to take a shuttle anyway consider a cheaper hotel where internet and breakfast are included.

Reviews.Title: “Only Stay If There Is No Convention Going On”
Reviews.Author: Jeff55z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Dallas on a Friday night after a late dinner at Five-Sixty. Unfortunately there was a large Mary Kay gathering at the hotel and it put a spoil in our stay. Our room had a great view that faced downtown. It overlooked the train and rail tracks, but we barely heard the trains as we were on the 15th floor. We did however here the extremely loud Mary Kay folks until 3am. At check out, the hotel did not seem prepared at all....... 30 minutes in line at the front desk, 30 minutes in line to give valet ticket, and another 30 minutes waiting for the car. We would only recommend staying at the Hyatt Regency Dallas is you a certain there is not a large convention or gathering going on that overwhelms the hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Low End Hyatt - Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt used to be one of the better ones. Unfortunately, it has allowed time to pass it by. Service is slow - at check-in at 7 pm, one clerk was staffing while 9 people waited in line. Apparently, the bad economy means that hotels like this are cutting staff. Worse yet is the loud nature of this hotel. Other reviewers have noted the location near the busy train route. However, in addition to this, the rooms that are lining the atrium face the loudness of the bar crowd (on this particular night, 2 am). Service is poor and slow. Room service was similar to a Holiday Inn, not at all what is expected from a Hyatt. Sadly, this hotel needs to go the way that Reunion Arena is going - closed. Unless you are stuck attending a meeting there, you can find many, many better choices in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A Noisy Place to Stay Unless You Like Trains”
Reviews.Author: GardenerDave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across from Union Station in downtown Dalls which means that there are both freight and commuter trains running in front of the hotel 24 hours a day 7 days a week; each time a commuter train enters the station it blows its horn apparently for saftey reasons; so unless you like trains, book an even-numbered room which should for the most part be on the non-train side of the hotel. Also, walls are very thin; we could hear every word of our neighbors and ventilation system rattles and bangs when it cycles on and off. I spent a week in this hotel for a series of meetings and with luck hope to never have to stay here again; I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who values sleep or privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Paid Perks not so Lovely”
Reviews.Author: matron54
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Dallas at Reunion is a lovely hotel. Common/public areas are quite nice and the overview of the center waterfall is exquisite. The rooms were nice but there was no refrigerator nor microwave available; neither was wifi included, it had to be purchased in order to be received in one's room. There was bottled water available in the room for $4.50 per bottle-well over-priced. For a stay at over $100 per night the perks that required payment were excessive. The staff were well groomed and friendly for the most part with the exception of a very small few. Although helpful, a couple of staff members from the front of the house (concierge and front desk) seemed less than anxious to provide need services, but others were very warm and willing to provide any services required. There was also a problem with service in the Casual Restaurant where service was never rendered. It took about five minutes to be acknowledged when waiting to be seated; when finally addressed, servicing was quickly interrupted by another patron cutting in and the hosted promptly began helping him and never returned to take my order. I do admit that after about a 10-15 wait, another staff member noticed me standing there and asked if I needed help but I could not wait any longer due to business restrains. Service had to be sought at their Specialty Restaurant ("Coffee's Post") instead where the quality of food received was less than desired. Personal pizza made-to-order was ordered and it was pre-made frozen pizza with merely a sprinkle of cheese and was heated an insufficent amount of time and the crust was burnt. The pizza tasted of freezer burn and was less than tasty; it was priced at $7. What was provided was much less than what was paid for. This same restaurant seemed to over-price most items; in example, individual Yoplait yogart that I typically purchase for 50 cents per container at Kroger or Wal-Mart was more than $3 per container at the "Coffee's Post"-EXCESSIVE! All-in-all my accommodations were nice enough but the paid perks were much less than lovely and were priced far above what I expected to pay; particularly since my accommodations were over $100 per night. I was slightly disappointed to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sebibond1
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Dallas is a huge convention hotel. I stayed there for one night and it was perfectly fine. Staff were friendly and attentive, the room was clean and the bed comfortable and updated. If you don't mind tons of people milling about, then it's a good place to stay for business.

Reviews.Title: “Sales Conference”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_O_Really
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything negative to say about this place. My room was on the 15th floor, quick elevators, clean comfortable rooms. Bed was great, bath was fine. Room service was prompt and the food was decent. If you don't like huge hotels then you should stay somewhere else. I'd recommend this hotel for anyone traveling on business.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy1001
Reviews.Content: The hotel was alright. When we arrived to our room it was beautiful!!! What a sight but what a noise. The train was below our room and it was very noisy. All night we listened to the horn blowing. Next morning when we woke up there was a leak coming from the vent. We had to switch rooms and the next one we were in was very dusty and still had the trains noise. It was still nice though. The food was great and there was a great staff!! I would go back only if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Big Convention Hotel and Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Matthew Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights for the proximity to downtown and the JFK museum. This hotel is big and hosts many conventions and events. There was a line during our check-in, we had to wait. That was not a big deal but the front desk was in such a hurry to check everyone in that it felt very impersonal and more like we were in a conveyor line. Definitely not the same Hyatt we experienced elsewhere. The location was hard to find when driving by car because it is at the intersection of several major highways in downtown Dallas. You have to navigate through some off ramps and on ramps if you are getting off one of the highway exits. Luckily we had a Garmin GPS and that helped tremendously. This hotel is part of the Reunion Tower and Arena complex. It looks modern on the outside but the room's were a little dated circa the 1980's. It reminds me of the Hotel Pennsylvania in NYC. The bathroom was small, old manual thermostat, old clunky 27" TV, old carpeting, and the gym had old equipment w/o AC. We had a Priceline reservation, they might have given us a dated room but I have a feeling all the rooms are the same. There is a big parking lot on the premise of the hotel but they restrict it for valet parking only at an unreasonable price of $20/day. We saved money by parking a block away (albeit down a small incline) at Reunion Blvd West for $10/day or less if you park by the hour. It's called Ace Parking which is directly to the left of the hotel and I have a picture of it. There is an attendant there 24/7, no in/out access but you don't have to deal with the busy valet. We were there when they honored Ross Perot one night and the hotel was more crowded and the valet was a giant mess. It looked like midtown Manhattan gridlock, we were glad we did self-parking. The Reunion Tower and restaurant is closed until at least Dec 08 for renovations. If you get a good deal for this place, it's not bad because of the location but otherwise I would stay elsewhere. Pro's: Location (within walking distance to JFK museum and the West End area) Con's: Dated rooms Impersonal staff Old equipment at Gym Ripoff for Valet Hard to find by car without GPS

Reviews.Title: “Here for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Maizie3213
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt when attending very large conference held there. We arrived at the Hyatt Regency by cab. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I was assigned to a room with 2 double beds in the Reunion Tower. The lobby level is large and beautiful, but it was somewhat confusing to navigate. There is a very expensive coffee/snack shop and gift shop with very limited seating. The elevators were essentially efficient. I never waited longer than 2-3 minutes, even during busy times. My room was clean and comfortable. The bedding was luxurious! There was a small closet with an ironing board and iron. The TV was a decent size but I didn't much of a chance to watch it. The bathroom was also very nice. They provided plenty of towels and toiletries. My only complaint about the room was the lack of electrical outlets. I needed to plug in my laptop and cell phone chargers, and I found only 2 outlets and they were very difficult to reach. We did not eat in any of the hotel's restaraunts, but they looked nice. We did enjoy cocktails at the second floor bar, and we found the prices reasonable and the service adequate. Overall, I enjoyed this hotel and had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “As expected.”
Reviews.Author: SConthemove
Reviews.Content: The Dallas Grand Hyatt is about what I expected from a large city Hyatt. I did not find any of the negativity expressed in other reviews (kids, noise etc.). The food is expensive, as is food in all major hotels in major cities. Rooms were clean, staff friendly and beds very comfortable. Kennedy Book Repository museum walkable and train station very close. Was there for a meeting and the hotel proved a nice venue.

Reviews.Title: “The Superdome?”
Reviews.Author: foveaproject
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel, with a nice staff. They just attract a client base that reminded me of the Superdome after a hurricane. If you travel in cargo shorts and flip-flops, sporting your newest tattoos and an unlimited supply of cigarettes. This is your Graceland. The staff is very tolerant of this business model. I assume since there are so many rooms they always have vacancy so they just fill it up with large groups and anyone walking down the street. I would not pay the rates they advertise, if you use priceline they are always the buyer of a cheap fair, and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “biggest raping my wallet ever suffered”
Reviews.Author: sigsix
Reviews.Content: The bed, linens, furniture and decor was beautiful with down comforter and pillows, The service was okay, but the cost what horrible. The room was medium sized and because we were here for a huge conference, there were no discounts, so the room was $145 per night for a king. There was no microwave, refrigerator or any other common convenience, but the coffee could be purchased downstairs and the cost rivaled Starbucks but the flavor didn't. The lamps were equivalent to a mid 80s motel except with fluorescent bulbs. Valet parking is $20 per night, and the internet is a whopping $10 for 24 hours. Oh and our key cards for the room were decoded twice in 3 days. This place was a massive expenditure and ruined an otherwise wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nunny51
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel. Restaurants way too expensive for the average family (about $13 for an average breakfast plate). Would recommend the Corner Bakery several blocks away for breakfast. Bar is also very expensive, $8.50 for a simple whiskey and 7-up. Extremely small pool for the size of the hotel, not many deck chairs. Requested frig 3 weeks in advance, none available on check-in, told it was first come, first served even if it was reserved. Finally got a frig. Very polite staff, although housekeeping knocked on the door at 830 AM. Great location, walking distance to at least 3 museums, the JFK 6th floor museum in the Dallas School Book Depository Building is a must-see. Lobby seating very limited, we were there for volleyball, not many places for team members to hang out together. One last tip, don't drink the $4.50 bottle of water in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Overrun by screaming 13 year olds”
Reviews.Author: kkbenton
Reviews.Content: Wow - DO NOT STAY HERE if you want to sleep. If you are interested in roaming bands of hundreds of unsupervised screaming children, apparently this is the place for you. There's really not much for kids at the hotel or in the area, so they were just chasing each other all over the hotel and joyriding in the elevators with the hotel staff doing nothing about it. Multiple times I waited over 20 minutes to get on an elevator along with a lot of annoyed adults. A group of kids would show up and literally push people out of the way to get on an elevator. I pointed out the > 100 or so people waiting on an elevator to the front desk staff and they suggested I go up to the 2nd floor and try to get on there. Another 100 people were waiting for the elevators on the 2nd floor. I went back down and asked where the stairs are - to my room on the 12th floor. The atrium area echoes sound so badly that the sound of the bar, restaurant, and lobby (oh and don't forget all the screaming kids) is amplified and very loud inside the rooms, even with towels shoved under the door and the tv on. I'm not saying the hotel should be supervising other peoples kids, but if they book kids dance competitions and volleyball tournaments and allow children to stay in rooms together without an adult, then they created this situation and should take the responsibility to deal with the result. Clearly Hyatt was not prepared for the situation they created, or is not interested in maintaining their reputation with business customers - or adults in general, for that matter. Other than that, the rooms were ok, although becoming a bit worn (peeling paint, torn wallpaper, scuffed furniture, stains) and it doesn't look like they are properly maintaining this hotel. Most likely their business has fallen off due to Reunion arena and renovating reunion tower and this is the result. On the positive side, the valet staff was great and very friendly. The (Parrinos?) restaurant was surprisingly very good. I got this room for $60 on priceline - so beware on priceline - if you bid on a 4 star hotel downtown, you are most likely to get the hyatt. Check expedia - I stayed at the Adolphus and Stoneleigh previous weeks for ~130/night booking through expedia. The extra money is definitely worth being able to sleep and not having to take the stairs 12 flights to your room. Unless you are a screaming 13 year old and want to spend the night joyriding in hotel elevators, I suggest you not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Thrown out by the Maid!!!”
Reviews.Author: danaides001
Reviews.Content: Everything went well right up to the morning of check out. We were there for our anniversary. The desk staff was efficient on check in and the valet parking was one of the most professional I've ever experienced. They were delivering cars in under 2 min! Wow.. can't say enough good about the valet parking employees. The wait staff in the bar was cordial and prompt. The problem.. THE PROBLEM.. was the maid.. the morning of our last day she is banging on the door at 8:22am.. BANGING ON THE DOOR .. when we finally wake up enough to put on clothes and peak out the door to see who it is.. (she is shouting through the door as well.. "Hey.. Hello' wake up!! ) I am not kidding.. I have never been treated like this in any hotel.. When we open the door.. she says literally.. 'WHEN YOU LEAVE???"... She wants us to hurry up and leave so she can clean the room.. I told her check out was at noon and we were in no hurry. Of course after being so rudely treated and mad we couldn't go back to sleep so we showered and got the hell out of there.. we were gone by 9am.. If Hyatt needs their rooms so badly.. we can do them even better.. We'll never stay in another one of their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: We had an average sized room with a great view of the city from the 22nd floor. I love Hyatt's beds - great linens and down duvet. A small refrigerator, and coffee maker were in the room. The pool looked very small and the water was murky so we didn't get in. Other Hyatt's we have stayed in have a sauna or steam room but this one did not. The restaurant we tried at the hotel had the exact same menu as the room service menu (including the same high prices - $20 for a chicken fried steak). All in all we enjoyed our stay and would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel ever. Avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: JimSF
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an atrium room. There is a sports bar in the atrium which is incredibly noisy, even at 1 AM, and the noise carries straight through the door. If you cannot get a non-atrium room-- especially if you'll be here on a weekend night-- you should find some other hotel. We are talking about serious noise here. I am not super sensitive-- I live directly next to the Bay Bridge in San Francisco-- but this is loud and disturbing, clanking of glasses, shouting, etc., and it's still going at 1 AM. The front desk people were nice about it, and managed to find me earplugs once I insisted and talked to the manager, and they took off most of my internet charges, but it doesn't make up for an intolerable room.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel; horrible pool”
Reviews.Author: thekidsmom
Reviews.Content: All you could expect from a Hyatt of this size; great convention hotel. Nice bar, snack area, etc. Rooms are nice (especially since I got it for $55 on price line!) However, we were extremely dissapointed in the pool! For a hotel of this size, I would have expected a MUCH larger pool. I've been in private backyards with larger pools. My kids were totally bummed and had to check it out 2 different times throughout the day b4 there was enough room for them to even get in. There are also very few deck chairs, so if you are looking to just lay out and get some fresh air, you might be sitting on the deck. Valet is $20 for 24hrs with in/out privileges. The park it yourself option is $10 with no in/out.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't be my first chocie for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: aperio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights in May. Check-in was a breeze and overall I didnâ€™t have any problems with the room. The room was a good size and was clean. The Hyatt had a note in my room that said if you use your â€œPrivacy Pleaseâ€� sign then the maids wonâ€™t change you room at all. I used this sign so I could leave my laptop setup when I was out of my room and to their credit the maids didnâ€™t enter my room at all over the 4 days I was there (I left the sign out the whole time). Iâ€™ve been to other hotels where they pretty much just ignore the sign and the maids enter at 8:00am anyway. I have different observations if youâ€™re a business traveler versus a family traveling on vacation. Iâ€™ll start with a quick tip for business travelers. I was traveling on business and high-speed internet is always key for me. I ended up on the 6th floor in a room pretty far away from the lobby area. When I connected to the hotels high-speed internet service via wi-fi (the only option possible in my room) the signal I got was very low. A number of times my connection would just drop when I was connected for even a short time. I asked at the front desk regarding what could be done and they gave me a device (they called it a booster) which plugged into my laptop and that did the trick. I didnâ€™t have any problems with dropped connections after that and I didnâ€™t have to pay anything for the booster, so good save on the Hyattâ€™s part since otherwise they would have had to move me to a room with better reception. As for my other business (and families) advice, the Hyatt isnâ€™t near much in terms of restaurants that you can easily walk to so either rent a car if you tire easily of room service, expect to take some cab rides, or go across the street to the light-rail system if you want to venture away from the Hyatt (room service was actually pretty good and pretty fast â€“ but not cheap). For families traveling who are looking for a resort experience just one word or warning, the pool and hot-tub at the Hyatt are fairly small and are on the roof on the 3rd floor. When I was there it was very, very hot on the roof with virtually no shade (no umbrellas or covered chairs). If your looking to spend some serious time by the pool I think that would make the Hyatt a bad choice -- I was out on the pool deck on a 90+ degree, sunny day and it was unbearable. Also, the Hyatt has a coffee shop on the lobby level, itâ€™s a great place to get soft drinks, pizza or snacks for the kids. I almost walked past without noticing all the goodies they had for sale. Cab fare from DFW to the hotel was $45 and took about 30 minutes. My room faced the train tracks and I never was bothered by the noise, but you might want to ask for a room away from the tracks if your easily disturbed by outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ATLNate
Reviews.Content: This is a typical monster hotel that caters to conventions and business travellers. Overall not a lot to complain about. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: -Big hotel with lots a amenties and entertainment -Nicely appointed rooms with very comfortable beds -Good location in Dallas' west end near Deally Plaza Con -Have to walk under a bridge that is infested with birds and bats to get to the West End district I read a few reviews that complained about noise. My room (12th floor) looked over the train tracks and I never heard a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Mother's Day weekend”
Reviews.Author: Masonpips
Reviews.Content: Considering the price of $65/night (Priceline) it was a great stay. We had 3 rooms, all with 2 beds, at this rate and it's our 3rd year in a row winning this hotel. We use the parking lot just outside the hotel for overnight parking ($10/night), love the coffee shop for a quick snack or breakfast and haven't had issues w/the staff, service or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Tired, Tired”
Reviews.Author: laplume9254
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. It was a convention hotel pick. The room was very tired...spots on the carpet, burned out light bulbs, TV remote in need of a battery. The bed, in an attempt to make it a heavenly bed, lacked the proper sized sheets. The bedding ended up off the bed in the middle of the night and was just "too much" to make it acceptable. The location is scary....we were warned not to walk around after dark in this section of town. In our opinion, it just stays in business because of its location close to the convention center. If you are not at the convention center, don't waste your money and time here.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel, but it is a fairly standard convention hotel. A bit older (as is demonstrated by its cameo in the opening montage of the TV series, Dallas) but very well maintained. Rooms are standard Hyatt rooms. Location is odd, because although you're close to downtown, it is separated by a winding road beneath a railroad viaduct, making it a bit more inconvenient to walk anywhere than its location would suggest. My room had a beautiful view of downtown, including a direct line of sight to the iconic Reunion Tower (which is attached to the property). The hotel restaurant (Centennial Cafe) was not very good. By far the worst chicken fried steak I have ever had in Texas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: julie4
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I've stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Dallas, and the third time it's been great. Overall, the hotel is excellent, clean etc. Only downside is dining, valet, internet, etc is very pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the atrium rooms!”
Reviews.Author: EdocEsrom
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and our room was clean and comfortable. The location was good, with easy access to the trains and walking distance to the West End and convention center. However, our room was on a balcony overlooking the bar/restaurant area. Although the view was beautiful, the noise is horrific. The acoustics in the atrium make every noise sound like it's right outside your door and we were kept awake every night by noisy bar patrons until about 2 in the morning (I'm guessing that's closing time). It would have been nice if the hotel management had asked the bar patrons to be more considerate of those who use a hotel to sleep as I can't imagine they aren't aware of the noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “A Serviceable Convention Hotel in a Lackluster Downtown”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th or 6th time Priceline has sent me to a "Grand" or "Regency" Hyatt in a major US city. Each time I was well pleased with the value for the money, but each time, the price was well under 50% of the lowest published rate. These Hyatts are 30-40 year-old convention hotels. They are 3-3.5 stars, not 4-star hotels. Nice rooms, nice amenities, but old and lacking the "dreamy" beds of nicer Starwood and Marriott hotels. The Dallas Hyatt sits at the edge of downtown, behind the railroad station. While some reviewers have complained of freight train noise, it should be no problem if you are used to even a little bit of "big city" traffic noise. It is set off from the rest of the downtown by some underpasses that are not particularly hospitable at night. Thus, while much of downtown is within walking distance, you may not wish to chance the walk after dark. The Hyatt has the obligatory huge atrium and multiple dining/drinking options. The next-door revolving restaurant tower, however, is under construction. The food/drinks were serviceable, if overpriced. The staff was most friendly and well-intentioned. Bottom line -- I wouldn't book this hotel at published rates. If I had a choice and a car, I would stay at a suburban hotel near dining/entertainment. This is one of those downtowns that shuts down at night. It is not a residential city center.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt--A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: 47203Traveller
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was the first time I have been to Dallas, and it was centrally located to the downtown so I was able to walk to most all of the attractions. It is also connected to the train terminal (but I never used this) The food was excellent. The rooms were clean, modern, and had great views. I would suggest this to anyone who can afford it. One warning: Some of the parts of Dallas will have homeless who will approach you for change. Some were outside of the train depot but generally would not bother you if you kept walking.

Reviews.Title: “Service letdown”
Reviews.Author: Piocaesare
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Dallas was chosen as the "host hotel" for a regional gymnastics competition we attended this past weekend. Fourteen families from Washington (state) stayed at the hotel for one night. My family had a one-bedroom suite and it was considerably nicer than the average suite through the lack of a minibar/fridge was a minor inconvenience. The rooms are modern and clean, the beds are comfortable, and the hotel staff is friendly and helpful. However, the issues we (and other families in our group) had with room service were terrible. After tallying up the "damage" our group ended up with 4 dinners delivered more than one hour after promised time (out of 5 dinners ordered). In our case, we ordered breakfast for 6:30-6:45am. Because of past issues at Hyatt's we not only filled out the door-hanger-menu but we gave it to one of the staff who delivered it to room service the night before. We needed to leave the hotel at 7:15am sharp for the gymnastics meet. At 7:05, no breakfast. I called room service, they acknowledged my order, but said they were busier than usual and it would be at least 15 more minutes before breakfast would be delivered. We cancelled breakfast (and were not charged for it) and were able to run to a nearby store and get a bagel and some fruit juice. On the bus over to the gymnastics meet we talked to other parents who were very upset that they travelled 2000 miles, stayed in a fairly high-end hotel, and now their kids would be competing in a 4-hour gymnastics meet without having had breakfast. This is something that would be forgivable for a 2-star hotel but not for a 3-star or higher hotel. It's possible the room service experience might be better if the hotel were half full or less. I won't be returning to this Hyatt. If you plan to stay there I recommend: 1) Find out how full they expect the hotel to be when you are staying there. 2) Don't depend on room service. Have a back-up plan or be OK waiting.

Reviews.Title: “It's big and somewhat pricey - good location”
Reviews.Author: KCRazorback
Reviews.Content: Stayed over new years 31st -2nd. This place will always have lots of football fans attending the Cotton Bowl over new years, so it gets slammed . They were the host hotel for one of the football teams - so mostly all fans from one school - just make sure that is your team. They do a decent job of managing the crowds, especially at the valet. The rooms were just okay - not as clean as I hoped - somewhat dirty pillow cases, but they do have 1100 rooms, so I cut them some slack. The location is great as they are connected to the DART public transit system, real close to the West end and only a $10 or so cab ride up to the uptown area (I suggest two restaurants in uptown - Cuba Libre and Zizikis). The main bar in the atrium is pretty nice, lots of TVs, places to lounge and shuffelboard. One disappointing note was that due to being completely sold out with so many late check outs, as of 3 PM new year's day, they did not get around to cleaning our room and said that the staff was going home at 5:30, so it couldn't be done. Valet parking at $18 (free entry/leave) seemed worth it over trying to figure out and haul to a further parking lot for $10 (which was not free entry/leave). Did find out the attached Reunion Tower is closed for remodling till sometime late in 2008. It's a bit tricky to get to the hotel itself off the Interstate, make sure you have some detailed directions or a GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service - Loud area”
Reviews.Author: gee_ess61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for the recent Cotton Bowl over New Year's Weekend and the hotel staff was unbelievably friendly, helpful, and personable if you consider that this is a huge, busy weekend in a gigantic hotel filled to capacity. Usually, this makes a staff cranky and unpleasant, in my experience. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. I like to stay in hotels that have upgraded to softer mattresses with sheets/down comforters instead of gross bedspreads, and the Hyatt fit the bill. My only complaint - and it could be a big one for some people - is that one side of the hotel overlooks three train tracks. Two of the tracks carry commuter traffic and the third seems to be a regular freight train track. During the night, trains ran OFTEN with increasing frequency as the morning arrived. Twice during the night freight trains came through and my floor literally vibrated from the noise (by the way, I was all the way on the 6th floor). It was a little creepy and I thought I might have imagined it, but it occured the second night we were there also. If you plan a visit to the Hyatt, ask to be put on the far side of the hotel away from the trains and you will probably be okay.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline Deal”
Reviews.Author: greatone3800
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend (Friday -Monday) while I was in town for a Cowboys game. Priceline (4 stars, downtown Dallas) for $55/night. I'm not at all familiar with Dallas but downtown Dallas is pretty much dead on the weekends. If I were to stay there again for a weekend, I'd look more uptown. Parking: Based on other Tripadvisor recommendations, we used the self-park a half block from the hotel (from the main entrance, just take a left). $10/day with no in/out versus $18/ day for the hotel valet. There always seemed to be a long line for the valet, so it seemed easier to self-park. Check-in: Arrived late night/early morning, so no long lines. Check-in was quick. I asked for a room with a city view and there was no problem getting one. Room: King bed, non smoking with city view. Standard room. Nothing special . We were on the 8th floor with a decent city view. There's trains that run on that side of the hotel, but the noise did not bother us at all (just rolling of trains, not blowing of horns, etc). The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever sleep in. Housekeeping: We forgot to put the privacy sign up so housekeeping kept knocking. Food: We tried the breakfast buffet at Centennial Cafe on Sunday. $15/person. Standard fare: fruit, breads, potatoes, eggs, cereal. No pancakes or french toast, which I would hope to get for that price. Overall, good Priceline deal, but I don't think this hotel warranted a four-star

Reviews.Title: “Great building, inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that was featured on the opening credits of the TV show Dallas for many years, and remains the epitome of the mirrored glass architecture from the late 70s/early 80s in Dallas. That, and the trademark atrium, date this hotel somewhat. Still, they have done a nice job of updating things. Rooms are airy and sizable--and placing the beds overlooking the view (as opposed to parallel to the windows) make the room feel bigger still. Good beds, and enjoyable showers, with noteworthy water pressure. My room, 2321, had a good view of the skyline, and many of the rooms on that side of the hotel do--request one. The hotel is well located for highway access, particularly for a downtown hotel. Valet parking is $19.50 a day, and can be slow for car retrieval. Internet is $10 per day--obscene given margins on this service, and outrageous given that many less expensive hotels no longer charge for this. Fitness center is well maintained, and though some equipment could use updating, it is nicely furnished and free to guests. There is a pool and hottub on 3, but can't say it looked very welcoming. . .overlooks the back side--a rather desolate view--of the hotel. What is frustrating about the hotel is the service--while always pleasant, it can be lacking. Housekeeping just made my bed and replaced my towels one day--no tidying up. Another day, they neglected to come, altogether. In fairness, the hotel recouped well, and I got follow ups from the housekeeping manager and the assistant rooms manager--both of whom attempted to make amends. While recovery was good, there were sufficient lapses to disappoint. Yes, got this room for $59 a night on Priceline, but still expect good service from a 4 diamond Hyatt Regency. . .with work, perhaps I would be impressed next time. Building, overall, is a pleasant surprise--and if service had been at the same level, this would be a great find, particularly at the Priceline rate. Would still return, but would caution those paying full price that you may or may not get 4 diamond caliber service during your stay. And note to hotel--seek ways to eliminate internet fees. . .it feels as if you are nickel and diming your guests. Bad.

Reviews.Title: “A generic conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: nhunixguy
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency in Dallas is a predictable and unexciting place to stay for a few days. The only big news is that the Reunion Tower just closed for 12-18 months of renovations, and this includes the Antares restaurant and the bar on the floor above. The other hotel restaurants are unexciting and will close for private events on random days without any warning that I could find. The rooms were clean and the biggest housekeeping problem was that I was allotted only one bar of soap that I had to move back and forth from the sink to the shower. I didn't ask for a second bar of soap, and housekeeping apparently didn't think it was necessary during the 3 nights I was there. The hotel sits close to railroad tracks, and you'll hear the trains no matter what floor you're on. I was able to mask the sound for a little while with the A/C unit, but the fan would always return to "AUTO" after a few hours and then I'd hear the trains again. I could have stayed on the other side of the building away from the trains, but the vibrations are still there and the view is worse. The conference rooms were typically air conditioned too much and the food was average. It could be that this is what was paid for and attendees of other conferences may rave about the food. The high point of this hotel (literally) is the tower which is now closed. I'd look for another hotel if I were returning to Dallas. This one was clean and safe, but as a Hyatt, I expected much more than I got.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - esp if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: matt_tx00
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hyatt Regency Dallas several times - most recently in Nov 2007. The hotel is great for quality, location, and convenience. The lobby and the rooms are very nice - on the high end for a Hyatt. The rooms have comfortable beds with all the extras. Best part about this place is that there are always Hotwire and Priceline deals available - this is "4 star" on Priceline and most recently I got a room with a $70 bid. The hotel has "express check in" kiosks - even if you book on Priceline or Hotwire the kiosk will let you pick the kind of room you want (which floor, park view vs. city view, etc). The hotel is a great location on the east side of downtown Dallas - convenient to all the major freeways (I-30, I-35E, I-45). You are minutes away from the West End Marketplace, the JFK memorial, the State Fair, Deep Ellum, and the clubs/restaurants in the Oak Lawn/Cedar Springs area. Dallas' rail line runs very close to the hotel as well. Some tips: The hotel is at the I-35E exit for Corporate Drive *East* (not West). When leaving the hotel, you need to take a right at the second light to get onto the freeway (the first light will take you into downtown). For parking, use the public lot at the bottom of the hill. Its a max of $10/day - its cheaper than paying the Valet parking plus you can come/go as you want *quickly* any time day/night. You'll just have to walk your suitcase a short ways up the hill. This is one of those huge anonymous hotels so inevitably some people who expect a lot of personal service are going to be unhappy with it. Only negatives I saw: you hear some "industrial" noise in there at night (I don't know if its the elevator or what?). Might wanna bring earplugs. Also - Hyatt tends to nickel and dime you to death (charge extra for little things like $4 bottled water and $2.50 spray starch).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jhouston1971
Reviews.Content: Overall very pleased, especially considering some of the complaints posted here. I was on the 24th floor above the railroad tracks and I didn't hear much noise. Layout and Decor of the room was quite nice and my view of downtown Dallas and the new Victory area was impressive. Everyone I encountered at the hotel was top notch. Check-in was extemely quick and courteous. Same goes for the valet service. Only complaint was that the in room internet service seemed slow. At any rate, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ooohh Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ColleenieWeenie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and have found the suites to be very clean, the beds comfortable, the amenities available, and the location excellent. Stayed at the end of October and was able to use the heated outdoor pool; I'm from Wisconsin, so swimming in a 91 degree pool on a sunny Dallas October afternoon was a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but loud.”
Reviews.Author: RkyMtnHi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt because of a conference I was attending. I was given a room that overlooked the Atrium (1145)--literally, over the whole Atrium area. Check in was easy and room staff and service were absolutely wonderful. I had a problem with my bed light not working and they sent up a mechanic who fixed the problem in no time (it really was electrical--I had identified the faulty cord, but he made the thing work consistently!). I ordered room service three times and it was impeccable every time--expensive and extremely filling, but very good ($23 for the standard breeakfast). You even get the unexpected steamed asparagus and grilled tomato for breakfast...veggies for breakfast--a nice treat! Thermostat in the room was crazy, it took some fine tuning to adjust it correctly. The beds were awesome--so comfortable. My view stunk--roofs, trains (and the whistles!) and the tower elevator was my view, but hey, I'm working, so what. My tub was clogged--I left a message with the front desk when I left--didn't have time to call before then and it didn't seem to bother me (my own filth, I guess? Eww!). I had dinner in the revolving tower one night--it was great and an absolutely wonderful view--nice sunset, full moon, great view of the book depository...I'm being bad, but it really was our initial view...apparently you revolve once an hour and that's how we figured that out. Having a drink up there proved to be a weird experience, so we opted for the hotel bar. Great bar but the World Series was on (poor Rockies!), so it was packed--no service at all. But I was here the day before the Series (and ironically, the day before our conference) and there was hardly anybody at the bar and I received superb service. I got to know "Bob" really well! I also had breakfast in the breakfast buffet area (forgot the name)-it was $15 (included juice and coffee) and a nice selection. I like that the hotel serves Starbucks--I know, I'm a coffee snob. Stay away from scrambled eggs though. They will cook whatever eggs you want, so do that option! I had the scrambled "eggs" at a conference brunch and they were gross--it tasted like powdered eggs...I backpack, so I know what they taste like! Other things, let's see--I forgot my workout clothes and they have a pretty nice gym and an outside terrace on the 3rd floor. They actually sold me a workout outfit (shorts and a t-shirt) for $15! It wasn't that bad and hey, I felt better about all the drinks at the bar! The one bad thing: The atrium rooms are LOUD!! Granted, I am a light sleeper and I always bring earplugs. On most nights, I just cranked the AC fan and the little wall that separates the foyer from the room seemed to work well for noise control (bar noise like loud laughing, glasses clinking, etc.). However, on my last night, there was a YoungLife conference or something and those kids were going nuts clapping and chanting until 1:00am. It's a good thing I have insomnia when I go on work travel, otherwise I think I might have killed them. I ordered a glass of wine to my room at 11:30 to wind down and the room service guy was saying that alot of people were complaining about the noise. So, just be forewarned: Atrium room=great interior view, lots 'o noise. My friends in the interior rooms said they heard nothing, so that might be something to consider if you don't bring earplugs! Last things--you can check in and print your boarding passes at the front desk and cabs were always lined up whenever we needed them. Really, the staff was absolutely wonderful in every aspect. Oh, one more thing--there is a BBQ joint called Sonny Bryan's Smokehouse BBQ that is relatively close to the hotel...it was recommended, but eh, not so much. I'm from the south originally, so you really have to have some good BBQ to impress me. I was happy to have some good fried okra and all, but the place struck me as somewhat of a tourist lure. Heck, if you never eat BBQ, you just might like it! But I digress...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not enough exercise equipment”
Reviews.Author: NoVAFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at this hotel. I had a very nice room that must have been on the opposite site of the railroad....I did not hear the train. The room was very clean and large, the bed was very comfortable, and I had a good internet connection. The service was efficient and the staff seemed to be friendly and helpful. The only complaint I had was that there did not seem to be enough exercise equipment for a hotel this large. Even very early in the morning the equipment was constantly in use.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Plan on Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: dsrnyc
Reviews.Content: Not recommended if you like to sleep. The hotel sits DIRECTLY on a major train station that serves 4 different trains - DART (Dallas Area Rapid Transit) commuter trains, Trinity and Amtrak long distance trains during the day and then at night - ALL night - mile long freight trains rumble past the hotel. Not only does each blow its horn repeatedly, but long before and after the freight trains pass the hotel the echo of it riding the rails can be heard. Having read the reviews I thought I was safe being on a high floor, but no such luck. If you have to stay I highly recommend the back side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All i can say is WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Whoadie
Reviews.Content: When i got here in Dallas it was culture shock!! i never been to a city like this i been to L.A and Seattle & Portland and a few other cities but this Dallas experience was a great the valet was ok didnt know the valet was $18 for 24 hours so after the first one i park my car a block away for cheaper but great. the front desk was outstanding, told me what i needed to know! they gave me room 911 it was funny to have that room number but great view of a building with BELO on it and also the train station and some building that was lighted up green the whole night. the room was great kinda was disappointed in the tv was expected a HDTV type tv not a 23 inch plain TV with a keyboard for the price i pay. that suck but the bathroom was nice like the doorway to get in the bathroom! the bed was great and did i say the view, i like the place. the reunion tower was great to the bill was over a $100 but the Antraes resturant was great so many couples, kinda happy i wasnt the only couple up there that 360 degree was like wow! the breakfast was great also so many dallas cowboys fans eating their on Sunday but i love everything i recommend this hotel to anyone!! 5 ***** Jeff Carter New Orleans,LA

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: karays
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean but when we went to bed is when we realized they stuck us in a room on the rail road tracks. We were on the tenth floor.
